title: China donates $250,000 worth of humanitarian items to Afghanistan
description: In June, 2010 China donated $250,000 worth of humanitarian goods to IDPs and repatriated refugees in Jawzjan Province. The donated goods included food, blankets, tents and other utilities.
name: Shibirghan

title: China donates 2m RMB for schools for war orphans in Afghanistan
description: In March 2003, China donated 2,000,000 RMB for the construction of two schools for war orphans in Afghanistan. The money was given to the Chinese Embassy in Afghanistan. The fund comes from donation initiated by 'Window of the World' Magazine in November 2002. On 17 June 2003, in Kabul, Afghan Education Minister Mohammad Yunus Qanooni and Chinese Ambassador to Afghanistan Sun Yuxi signed an agreement on the construction of the 2 schools- one in Kabul and another in Parwan. The construction would be implemented and monitored by the Chinese Embassy. The two schools were completed in September and October 2003. As of 2009, the 'friendship' schools had 2400 students.
name: Kabul

title: Chinese Government provides grant for reconstruction of two primary schools in Paghman District
description:
In 2016, the Embassy of China in Afghanistan provided a grant for the reconstruction of Miba elementary school (米巴小学) and Tahgwa elementary school (塔格瓦小学) in Paghman District and Kabul Province. The amount of the grant is unknown. The reconstruction handover ceremony was held on September 17, 2016. 

There are nearly 4,000 students in a school in Tahgwa, including 1,800 girls. Due to the poor state of school buildings, the limited number of classrooms can only accommodate students in batches. After the completion of the school reconstruction project, the classroom windows of the two schools were equipped with glass; the roof was reinforced and made rainproof; private toilets were installed. and the new school building greatly improved the enthusiasm of local residents to send their children to school. 

STAFF_NOTE: These two schools are also known as the China-Afghanistan Friendship School in Paghman District. The spelling of these elementary schools cannot be found, so we simply provide pinyin translations.
name: Paghman

title: China donates desks and chairs to China-Afghan Friendship School
description:
On April 15, China Embassy in Afghanistan donated desks and chairs to China-Afghan Friendship School in Paghman District, Kabul, Afghanistan. The school is renamed as "China-Afghan Friendship School" （中阿友谊学校). This project is completed. 

In March 2018, China donated textbooks to China-Afghan Friendship School, which is recorded in project #54110.
name: Paghman

title: China provides anti-terrorism and anti-drug training to police officers of Afghanistan (Linked to Project ID#37849)
description: On 28 October 2014, China announced that it would hold training on anti-terrorism and anti-drugs for Afghanistan. The announcement was made during Afghan's President Mohammad Ashraf Ghani Ahmadzai visit to China. On the same date the announcement was made, China and Afghanistan signed an agreement on economic and technical cooperation, under which China would provide 2 billion Chinese Yuan in grant (See Project ID#37849). China previously had been providing small-scale security training to Afghanistan, specifically in the form of mine clearance and counter-narcotics training. In January 2015, the Xinjiang Frontier Corps and the Xinjiang Police College hosted the first Afghan anti-drug and anti-terrorism training seminar. The training was concluded on 29 January 2015 at Urumqi, Xinjiang. 50 police officers from the Afghanistan Interior Ministry Anti-drug, Anti-terrorism, and Border authorities Department participated in the training that lasted a month, and were later awarded the certificate of completion by the People's Republic of China Ministry of Public Security and the Ministry of Commerce.
name: Dih Sabz

title: China provides $1.4 million in material aid to Afghans Ministry of Interior
description: In July 2003, China and Afghanistan's Interim government signed an agreement with China. China will provide the xequipment and vehicles. It's worth 1.4 million US dollar in total, includes 22 Cherokee vehicles. The equipment and vehicles were handed over on June 30, 2004. The communication equipment came from Shandong Weifang Huaguang Communication Co., Ltd. The 22 vehicles came from Beijing Jeep Automobile Co., Ltd.
name: Dih Sabz

title: China opens Confucius Institute in Kabul University, Afghanistan
description: In January 2008, an agreement was signed between China and Afghanistan for the establishment of a Confucius Institute at Kabul University. This project is funded by Hanban, a government organization that partners universities around the world with Chinese educational institutions to establish Confucius Institutes for the study of Chinese language and culture. The Chinese university involved with this project is Taiyuan University of Technology. On 7 April 2013 China reopened the Confucius Institute at Kabul University after it had been closed for 18 months due to instability in Afghanistan. The institute now offers Mandarin classes to around 100 Afghan beginners. There are one teacher from China and two Chinese instructors teaching mandarin at elementary levels.
name: Kabul City

title: Chinese Government provides $15 million grant for Teaching Building of the Chinese Language Department and the Guest House of Kabul University Project
description:
In March 2011, the Chinese Government and the Government of Afghanistan signed an exchange of notes for the Teaching Building of the Chinese Language Department and the Guest House of Kabul University Project. The Chinese Government reportedly committed about $15 million of grant funding for this project. China 19th Metallurgical Corporation (MCC19) was the contractor responsible for project implementation. 

This project began in October 19, 2012. The project was completed on November 30, 2014. It was then officially handed over to the Afghan side on December 23, 2014. The Chinese Language Department is a 3-storey building with a total floor area of 2,053.5 square meters, which is capable of accommodating 200 students to have classes at the same time. The guest house is a 5-storey building with a total floor area of 4,588 square meters, offering 48 dormitories and the supportive facilities for the foreign teachers working at Kabul University. 

STAFF_NOTE: The Chinese project title is 阿富汗喀布尔大学中文系教学楼和招待所项 or 喀富汗喀布尔大学中文系教学楼和招待所项目后的第. This project is located at Kabul University. The locational coordinates of Kabul University are available at https://www.google.com/maps/place/Kabul+University/@34.5173801,69.1337345,17z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m5!3m4!1s0x38d16f2c550c3f59:0xa47b5d537e5b7214!8m2!3d34.5173801!4d69.1359232.
name: Kabul City

title: Chinese Government provides $4.35 million grant for Jamhuriat Hospital Renovation Project (Linked Project ID #34498, #69992, #69993, #54775)
description:
In 2003, the Chinese Government provided a $4.35 million grant for the Jamhuriat Hospital Renovation Project in Kabul. The project involved the reconstruction of approximately 6,000-7,000 square meters of the hospital, the installation of medical examination facilities such as CT-scans and X-rays, the provision of electrocardiogram and blood test instruments, and the installation of an air-conditioning system. 

China Railway Shisiju Group Corporation, which is also known as China Railway 14th Bureau Group Co., Ltd., and China National Complete Plant Import Export Corporation (COMPLANT) were the contractors responsible for project implementation. This project was launched on August 2, 2003. However, the hospital building collapsed in July 2004 during the construction process, killing 6 construction workers and injuring at least 30 others. The construction restarted from March 2007 and the opening ceremony was held on August 16, 2009.

This project is part of the $150 million donation in 2002 (#34498).

STAFF_NOTE: The Chinese project title is 阿富汗共和国医院维修项目.” According to "Foundation Stone of China-funded Hospital Building Laid in Kabul", the project is different than project #69993, which was construction on the main hospital building.
name: Kabul City

title: China donates $1m in aid to Afghan parliament
description: In 2006 China donated vehicles, security equipment and kitchenware to the Afghan Parliament. This donation was worth 1 million USD, and included 20 jeeps, 20 pickup trucks, sets of security monitoring system, and cooking supplies.
name: Kabul City

title: China donates Video Conference Systems to Afghanistan Ministry of Foreign Affairs
description: On May 10, 2017, Chinese Embassy in Afghanistan donated a Video Conference System to Afghanistan Ministry of Foreign Affair. The original source does not indicate the cost of the system.
name: Kabul City

title: China Grants 4.288268 million AFA to Afghan Ministry of Foreign Affairs (linked to #53879)
description: On October 1, 2016, China provided 4.288268 million AFA to the Afghan Ministry of Foreign Affairs. From November 20, 2008, to December 21, 2019, China provides 858,140,268 Afghanistan Afghani (approx. 16.4 million USD) aids to Afghan Ministry of Foreign Affairs. The contribution was delivered over multiple years. About 97 million AFA (1.5 million USD) was spent. The funds were given in a grant used for acquisition of assets and the use of goods and services (#53879). DAD Platform Refer Project Code: AFG/230069; Old Project Code: AFG/0866901
name: Kabul City

title: Donation of 30 million RMB of wheat to Afghanistan
description: On 30 December 2008, China signed an agreement to donate 30m RMB worth of wheat to Afghanistan as part of rebuilding efforts. The agreements were signed by Chinese Ambassador to Afghanistan Yang Houlan and Afghan Foreign Minister Rangin Dafar Spanta. According to online information provided by China's ECCO in Afghanistan, over 8,000 tons (or tonnes) valued at 30 million CNY were delivered during 2009: STAFF_NOTE: #34531 should not be duplicate for #34528 as their delivery times, contract signing times are different. This transaction was listed under year 2009 by the Chinese Ministry of Commerce, updated commitment year accordingly.
name: Kabul City

title: China trains 20 doctors for Afghanistan Jamhoriat hospital
description:
In 2008, China trained 20 doctors for Afghanistan Jamhoriat hospital. The training worths 630,000 USD.

STAFF_NOTE: In 2014, China again committed to train medical personnels in Jamhoriat hospital (#37896). Jamhuriat hospital is located in Kabul at the following address: Chara-e-searar, Disttec 2, Kabul, Afghanistan Kabul, Afghanistan 0093. Its exact locational coordinates are available at https://www.google.com/maps/place/Jamhuriat+Hospital,+Kabol,+Afghanistan/@34.5254674,69.1689225,15z/data=!4m5!3m4!1s0x0:0xb2238c27edd9b0c2!8m2!3d34.5254674!4d69.1689225”.
name: Kabul City

title: China provides Afghanistan 13 million Yuan for emergency assistance and uniforms
description: In 2002, China provides 13 million Chinese Yuan (equivalent to 4 million USD) to Afghanistan for emergency assistance as well as other aids. The fund was delivered in March 2002. The fund was used deliver medical supplies, stationary (80,000 pieces) and uniforms for the army (50,000 pieces) and police (20,000 pieces), 30 computers to Ministry of Foreign Affairs. Part of the medicine was utilized in the north during the crises of Nahreen Earthquake. The fund is fully disbursed and used by 2006. DAD platform referral code: DAD/000357. STAFF_NOTE: This Project is not affiliated to #34498 because the transaction amounts and currency are separate.
name: Kabul City

title: China donates $1m in office and sports equipment to Afghan government (Linked to Project ID#34515)
description: On 5 October, 2004, the Chinese government donated office equipment and recreational materials to Afghanistan's transitional government. This included 400 computers, 300 printers, TV sets, digital cameras, footballs, volleyballs and other athletic equipment. This donation was worth $1m. Chinese Ambassador to Afghanistan Sun Yuxi and Afghan Foreign Minister A. Abdulla signed the notes of exchange. This is the fourth largest donation made by China; in June 2004, China had just donated communication equipment and vehicles to the Afghan government (See Project ID#34515)
name: Kabul City

title: China donates equipment to Kabul University
description: On February 22, 2016, the Chinese government donated teaching equipment to Kabul University. Chinese Ambassador Yao Jing and Afghanistan Minister of High Education and President of Kabul University attended the ceremony. Among the equipment were laptop and desktop computers, microscopes, UPS (uninterruptible power supply) machines, projectors, printers and stationery. This project should not be confused with the construction of a building and auditorium at Kabul University, #53635.
name: Kabul City

title: Chinese Government provides RMB 500 million grant for the 10,000 Housing Units Project (Linked to Project ID #54451)
description:
On November 3, 2015, Chinese Vice President Li Yuanchao and Afghan President Ashraf Ghani signed an economic and technical cooperation agreement (ECTA) that made reference to a potential project 10,000 residential apartments in Kabul (#54451). These housing units would be allocated to civil servants — specifically, the families of deceased Afghan National Army, Afghan National Police, and National Security Forces personnel. 

Then, on May 16, 2016, Chinese Premier Li Keqiang and the Government of Afghanistan’s Chief Executive Officer Abdullah Abdullah signed an exchange of notes for a feasibility study on the construction of affordable home for government employees in Kabul. 

In March 2017, officials announced that the first phase of the project would include the construction of 1400 units the Old Darulaman Palace in Kabul. The next two phases of the project are reportedly dependent on the success of the first. 

Then, in May 2017, the Chinese Government and the Government of Afghanistan signed an RMB 500 million grant agreement to build 10,000 residential apartments in Kabul. China Railway Shisiju Group Corporation, which is also known as China Railway 14th Bureau Group Co., Ltd., is the contractor responsible for project implementation. Its work will be overseen by the Government of Afghanistan's Ministry of Urban Development and Housing. 

According to the report issued by Embassy of China in Afghanistan on Dec 9, 2018, the project has been made substantial progress. According to the report issued by MOFCOM on December 26, 2019, the project was still under implementation.

This project is linked to two other technical agreements that were also signed on November 3, 2015: a grant of 1500 scholarships for Afghan students (#54038) and aid to help Afghanistan with Taliban peace talks (#54039). 

STAFF_NOTE: The Chinese project title is 期对一万套住房项目.” This project is located in Kabul. The first phase of the project will involve the construction of 1400 housing units in the Old Dar-ul-Aman Palace in Kabul. The exact locational coordinates of the Old Dar-ul-Aman Palace can be accessed at https://www.google.com/maps/place/Kabul+Darul+Aman+Palace/@34.4651695,69.1172541,17z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m5!3m4!1s0x38d1692428be5ecf:0xd47cfa156e405994!8m2!3d34.4651695!4d69.1194428.
name: Kabul City

title: Protocol Vehicle Project
description: In February 2014, Afghanistan signed a letter for the Protocol Vehicle Project where China assisted Afghanistan's Ministry of Foreign Affairs with limousine vehicles. The project was completed in 2014.
name: Kabul City

title: Chinese Government provides RMB 7.94 million grant for Phase I of the Afghanistan Presidential Office Multifunctional Center Technical Cooperation Project (Linked to Project ID#34625)
description: In 2014, the Chinese Government agreed to provide an RMB 7.94 million grant to the Government of Afghanistan for Phase I of the Afghan Presidential Office Multifunctional Center Technical Cooperation Project (Linked to Project ID#34625). This project involved repairs to the Multifunctional Center within the Afghan Presidential Office, including the ventilation and air conditioning system, the water supply and drainage system, the heating and water supply system, power generation and lighting system. China Railway Shisiju Group Corporation, which is also known as China Railway 14th Bureau Group Co., Ltd., was the contractor responsible for project implementation. This project began on June 18, 2014. It was completed on December 4, 2017. This project is linked to #34625, the grant for the construction of the Presidential Office Multifunctional Center. STAFF_NOTE: As of 2019, Phase II of the Afghan Presidential Office Multifunctional Center Technical Cooperation Project was underway. This project was located at the Afghan Presidential Palace. Its locational coordinates are available at https://www.google.com/maps/place/ARG+Presidential+Office/@34.525212,69.174551,17z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m5!3m4!1s0x38d16eb2956e5717:0x9680ffc5f17f6a22!8m2!3d34.525212!4d69.1767397.
name: Kabul City

title: China donates 4,380 tonnes of wheat to Afghanistan
description: In May 2008, Afghanistan received a donation of 2,500 tonnes of wheat from China. The wheat was added to the country's reserves for cases of emergency. Additionally, ten trucks of wheat were given to the Kabul Municipality to be distributed to city bakers in order to reduce bread prices. The 2,500 tonnes which was handed over to the Afghan Ministry of Agriculture was the first consignment of a total donation of 4,380 tonnes of aid. In July 2008, it was reported that Afghanistan had received the rest of the donation. STAFF_NOTE: #34531 should not be duplicate for #34528 as their delivery times, contract signing times are different. This project is edited by November 2018 to add the exact transaction amount as 20 million Chinese Yuan according to the official source from Economic and Commercial Counsellor's Office of China in Afghanistan.
name: Kabul City

title: China donates $1 million in material aid to Afghanistan's Legislature
description: In April 2005, during the period that Afghan Vice President visited to China, China government pledged to provide suppliers that worth $1 million to support the parliamentary election of the Afghan government. The grants include 24 sets of security monitoring system, 20 jeeps, 20 pickup trucks, lots of cooking utensils, and others. At the beginning of September 2015, all the materials arrived at Afghanistan. The handover ceremony was held on November 9, 2005.
name: Kabul City

title: China donates material supplies to Afghanistan presidential palace
description: In November 2011 China and Afghanistan signed a contract under which China would donate material supplies to the Afghan presidential palace. On November 23, 2011, The agreement was signed by Wu Gangchen, Commercial Counselor of China Embassy in Afghanistan and Afghanistan Presidential Chief of Staff Abdul Karim Khurram. The material supply are expected to be shipped out in December 2011. On October 1, 2012, the materials handover certificate signing ceremony was held in Afghanistan. Ambassador Xu Feihong and Afghanistan Presidential Chief of Staff Abdul Karim Khurram were present to sign on behalf of their respective governments.
name: Kabul City

title: Chinese Government provides grant funding for landscaping and beautification of Kabul and the area surrounding the presidential palace
description: In 2012, the Chinese Government provided a grant to the Government of Afghanistan for the provision of snow shovel machines, street cleaners, and lawn mowers to support landscaping and beautification efforts in Kabul and the areas surrounding the presidential palace. The value of this grant is unknown. On October 1, 2012, a handover ceremony took place at the Afghan presidential palace. STAFF_NOTE: As the equipment handed over is intended for landscaping, not office supplies, this is not a duplicate of #53739.
name: Kabul City

title: China Grants 17.018 million AFA to Afghan Ministry of Foreign Affairs (linked to #53879)
description: On December 22, 2015, China provided 17.018 million AFA to the Afghan Ministry of Foreign Affairs. From November 20, 2008, to December 21, 2019, China provides 858,140,268 Afghanistan Afghani (approx. 16.4 million USD) aids to Afghan Ministry of Foreign Affairs. The contribution was delivered over multiple years. About 97 million AFA (1.5 million USD) was spent. The funds were given in a grant used for acquisition of assets and the use of goods and services (#53879). DAD Platform Refer Project Code: AFG/230069; Old Project Code: AFG/0866901
name: Kabul City

title: Chinese government to assist Afghanistan's Ministry of Public Works with office supplies
description: On 9 October 2011, China's Economic and Commercial Counselor and the Afghan Minister of Public Works Ahmed signed a contract for China to assist Afghanistan's Ministry of Public Works in the form of office equipment. Based on the agreement, the office equipment will be delivered by the end of December 2011. The equipment was financed by the Chinese government. On May 15, 2012, the handover ceremony of official equipment from China to Afghanistan was held on Afghanistan Ministry of Public Work. No sources indicate the content of the donation. According to Afghan Minister of Public Work Najibullah Aoudjan, the equipment will be used to improve the working conditions of Minister of Public Work.
name: Kabul City

title: China grants emergency aid worth 30 million RMB to support interim regime in Afghanistan (Linked to #37850, #34501, #34498)
description: In January 2002, Chinese President Jiang Zemin, Prime Minister Zhu Rongji signed an agreement to provide Afghanistan emergency aid package worth 30 million Chinese Yuan during the visit of Afghan interim leader Hamid Karzai. The aid package includes medicine, medical equipment, stationery, and sports products is for support of the temporary government. In March 2002, Northern Afghanistan was hit by Hindu Kush earthquakes, so part of the aid was also used for rehabilitation. The handover ceremony was held on March 26, 2002. The agreement was signed together with #37850, another assistance of 1 million USD in cash. For other 2002 earthquake response fund that China provided for Afghanistan, see #34501 for details. This project is part of a package of 2002-2005 China assistance to Afghanistan of 150 million USD reconstruction plan (#34498).
name: Kabul City

title: Chinese Government provides RMB 78.1 million grant for National Center for Science and Technology Education Project (Linked to Project #69620)
description:
In 2011, the Chinese Government agreed to support the National Center for Science and Technology Education Project in Afghanistan. China’s Ministry of Commerce reportedly committed RMB 78.1 million of grant funding for this project. With a total construction area of 7,891 square meters, the project involved the construction of laboratories, conference rooms, lecture halls, libraries and other facilities. The National Center for Science and Technology Education also reportedly doubles as a venue for cultural exchanges. 

China Railway Shisiju Group Corporation, which is also known as China Railway 14th Bureau Group Co., Ltd., was the contractor responsible for project implementation. Construction began on August 18, 2012, and ended on December 22, 2013, three months before the planned completion date. A project handover ceremony was then held on April 15, 2014. 

STAFF_NOTE: This project is also known as the Science and Education Center Complex Project. The Chinese project title is 国家科学教育中心 or 国家科教中心. This project captured the funding agreement for the construction of National Center for Science and Technology Education in Afghanistan. The project is linked to Project ID# 69620, which captured the technical cooperation between China and Afghanistan.
name: Kabul City

title: Chinese Government RMB 6 million grant for provision of police equipment to Afghanistan’s Ministry of Interior
description: On November 8, 2014, China delivered police equipment worths 6 million Chinese Yuan to Afghanistan. The equipment was handed to Minister of Interior. The materials handed over by the Chinese side include communication equipment, forensic cameras, police helmets and shields, and rapid detection equipment for drugs (drugs). The Chinese side also provided assistance to the Afghan in equipment operation training. In addition to these, there are some computer equipment, which is Lenovo's E49 model. The network shows that the price of such computers does not exceed RMB 4,000. There is no offensive weapon in this batch of public police materials, indicating that China has taken into consideration its stance and position when choosing assistance, and avoided transmitting information that is deeply involved in the armed conflict in Afghanistan.
name: Kabul City

title: Chinese Embassy donates television and sports equipment to Afghan school (Linked to Project ID#34507)
description: 31 October, 2009, Ambassador Zheng Qingdian donated two televisions, two table tennis rackets, ten boxes of table tennis balls, and two volleyballs to the Shah Schneider Secondary School. Vice Principal of the school thanked the Chinese Embassy in Afghanistan for their concerns with regards to education. Friendship between the Chinese and the Afghans in the education sector came about with the 'See the world' magazine. In 2002, 'See the world' magazine organized a large-scale photo exhibition called 'focus on Afghanistan war orphans', and raised capital amounting to 200 million yuan for the Afghan war orphans through charities and other activities. Of the total capital collected, more than $200,000 was used for the construction of the two Afghan friendship schools (See Project ID#34507)
name: Kabul City

title: China donates equipment to Afghan Bakhtar Agency
description: In 2003 the Chinese Embassy in Afghanistan donated equipment to Bakhtar Information Agency. This included three computers, three printers and five bicycles.
name: Kabul City

title: China donates $1.1 million in stationery items to Afghanistan
description: In 2003 China donated 1.1 million USD worth of stationery items to Afghanistan's transitional government in order to assist with its administrative tasks. There is 80,000 items in donation in total. It includes printing paper, inks, notebook, pen. Documents for this donation were signed in August between the transitional government and China's Ambassador to Afghanistan.
name: Kabul City

title: China Grants Office Furniture to the Confucius Institute and Guesthouse (Linked to: #34722)
description: On January 31, 2012 the Chinese Embassy and a representative of the Afghan government signed an agreement so that China would provide office furniture for the newly constructed Confucius Institute and Guesthouse located at the University of Kabul. The project was reported completed in 2015.
name: Kabul City

title: Chinese Government provides grant for the First Phase of the National Center for Science and Technology Education Technical Cooperation Project (Linked to Project #53742)
description: On July 10, 2017, First Phase of the National Center for Science and Technology Education Technical Cooperation Project in Afghanistan started. During the technical cooperation period, China Railway 14th Bureau Group Co., Ltd. sent five technical cooperation personnel, including one for civil engineering, one for strong electricity engineering, one for water supply and drainage system construction, one for heating and ventilation system construction, one for maintenance of mechanical and electrical equipment construction, and one for weak current and fire control system construction. China Railway 14th Bureau Group Co., Ltd. set up a technical team to go to Afghanistan to provide technical guidance for the use and maintenance of the equipment and facilities of the National Center for Science and Technology Education in Afghanistan, and train the technical personnel of the Afghanistan side. After two years' efforts of the expert group, nearly 100 professionals have been trained for the Institute of science and education center. It is reported that the Afghanistan side hopes to carry out the second phase of technical cooperation, so China Railway 14th Bureau Group Co., Ltd. will conduct further consultations with relevant departments in Afghanistan. The project was completed on October 26, 2018. This project shows a technology cooperation project. The project is linked to Project ID#53742, which captured the funding agreement for the construction of National Center for Science and Technology Education in Afghanistan.
name: Kabul City

title: China provides grant to the Jamhuriat Hospital Office Building Construction Project (Linked to Project ID #34502, #34498, #69993, #54775)
description: On 28 July 2005, Chinese Ambassador to Afghanistan Liu Jian and Afghan Public Health Minister Mohammad Amin Fatimi signed agreement for the construction for the new Jamhuriat Hospital Office Building Construction Project. The project includes the construction of a temporary office building and some additional board rooms. This project was completed on March 30, 2006. The hand-over ceremony, as well as the opening ceremony of the construction of the temporary medical house was held on March 30, 2006 in Afghan capital Kabul. The construction of the office building at the Jamhuriat Hospital is a medical building that would provide the place for treatment before the construction of the main medical building. STAFF_NOTE: The temporary medical building is separate from Chinese Government grant-financed medical building at the Jamhuriat Hospital. Therefore, the project is different from Project ID# 34502 which captured the Jamhuriat Hospital Renovation Project.
name: Kabul City

title: Chinese Government provides CNY 16.41 million grant to Jamhuriat Hospital Technical Cooperation Project For Training (linked to #69993, #34502, #69992)
description:
In 2015, the Chinese Government provided a CNY 16,410,000 grant to the Government of Afghanistan for the Jamhuriat Hospital Technical Cooperation Project. The purpose of this project is to provide on-site technical guidance and personnel training for the maintenance of the hospital's equipment (including ventilation and air conditioning, water supply and drainage, heating and water supply, power generation, lighting, elevators, and medical equipment) and also for supplying necessary spare parts for the equipment. 

China Railway Shisiju Group Corporation, which is also known as China Railway 14th Bureau Group Co., Ltd., was the contractor responsible for project implementation. This two-year project started officially on January 22, 2015. It was completed on December 4, 2017. 

The Chinese project title is 阿富汗共和国医院技术合作项目正. Earlier projects on Jamhuriat Hospital include #69993, #34502, and #69992.
name: Kabul City

title: China Grants 33.5 million AFA to Afghan Ministry of Foreign Affairs (linked to #53879)
description: On December 22, 2016, China provided 33.5 million AFA to the Afghan Ministry of Foreign Affairs. From November 20, 2008, to December 21, 2019, China provides 858,140,268 Afghanistan Afghani (approx. 16.4 million USD) aids to Afghan Ministry of Foreign Affairs. The contribution was delivered over multiple years. About 97 million AFA (1.5 million USD) was spent. The funds were given in a grant used for acquisition of assets and the use of goods and services (#53879). DAD Platform Refer Project Code: AFG/230069; Old Project Code: AFG/0866901
name: Kabul City

title: Chinese Government provides $25 million grant for Jamhuriat Hospital Construction Project (Linked to Project ID#34502, #69992, #54775)
description:
In 2005, the Chinese Government provided a $25 million grant to the Government of Afghanistan for 350-bed Jamhuriat Hospital Construction Project. This project involved the construction of 10-story hospital building with 350 beds and a total construction area of 16,611 square meters. 

A foundation stone laying ceremony for the hospital took place on November 2, 2006. The hospital was inaugurated on August 15, 2009. 

China Railway Shisiju Group Corporation, which is also known as China Railway 14th Bureau Group Co., Ltd., was the contractor responsible for project implementation. However, a year after the inauguration of the hospital, it was still empty due to staff shortages and the fact that the Government of Afghanistan had not allocated any operating funds to it. 

Then, in April 2011, Dr. Soraya Dalil, Afghanistan’s acting public health minister announced that the new building suffered from several problems, including a lack of surgery wards and a proper ventilation system. A second inauguration ceremony for this hospital was held on January 21, 2014. The hospital now provides 24-hour services and treats approximately 1,200 patients each day. Its services include: Cardiothoracic Surgery, Respiratory, Vascular Surgery, Neurology, Nephrology, Neurosurgery, Urology, Endocrinology, Oncology-Chemotherapy, and. Oncology-Radiotherapy. The hospital has two buildings: (1) a main building that has 10 floors with 1,000 rooms (with each floor allocated to a different kind of treatment), and (2) a four-story building that provide services for emergency patients, X-ray services, and administrative offices. The annual cost of operating the hospital is about $2.7 million. 

According to "Foundation Stone of China-funded Hospital Building Laid in Kabul", the project is different with project ID# 34502 which happened in 2003. Besides funding the construction of the main building, China will also equip the hospital with some medical furniture and instruments, according to agreements reached by the governments of China and Afghanistan, separately in 2003 and 2005.

STAFF_NOTE: This project is also known as the Jamhoryat Tertiary Hospital Construction Project or the Republic Hospital Construction Project. The Chinese project title is 喀布尔共和国医院 or 喀布尔共和国医院. The Farsi name of the project is شفاخانه جمهوریت.
name: Kabul City

title: Chinese Government provides RMB 32.7 million grant for Afghan Presidential Office Multifunctional Center Construction Project (Linked to Project ID#69984)
description:
In 2008, the Chinese Government provided an RMB 32.7 million grant for the Afghan Presidential Office Multifunctional Center Construction Project. The purpose of the Multifunctional Center (or Multifunction Center) was to host state dinners and press conferences and facilitate diplomatic negotiations. The project covered an area of 1150 square meters. This construction area was 2979 square meters. China Friendship Development International Engineering Design & Consultation Corporation (FDDC) and China Railway Shisiju Group Corporation — also known as China Railway 14th Bureau Group Co., Ltd. — were the contractors responsible for project implementation. 

Construction began on June 2, 2008. Then, on December 22, 2009, China’s Ambassador to Afghanistan Zheng Qingdian, was invited for a presidential visit to inspect the progress of project; high standards and strict requirements were expected in ensuring project quality especially for the 55th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties. Construction of the Multifunctional Center was completed at the end of December 2009. 

The project is linked to Project ID#69984, which captured the Technical Cooperation Project for Phase I of the Afghan Presidential Office Multifunctional Center. 

STAFF_NOTE: The Chinese project title is 阿富汗总统府多功能中心. This project was located at the Afghan Presidential Palace. Its locational coordinates are available at https://www.google.com/maps/place/ARG+Presidential+Office/@34.525212,69.174551,17z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m5!3m4!1s0x38d16eb2956e5717:0x9680ffc5f17f6a22!8m2!3d34.525212!4d69.1767397.
name: Kabul City

title: Chinese Government provides RMB 240 million grant for Kabul University Comprehensive Teaching Building and Auditorium Project (Linked to Project ID #54009, #53640, and #53999)
description:
On May 16, 2016, Chinese Premier Li Keqiang and Afghan Chief Executive Officer Abdullah Abdullah signed six bilateral cooperation documents, including an exchange of notes on the Kabul University Comprehensive Teaching Building and Auditorium Project. The Chinese Government committed approximately RMB 240 million in grant funding for this project, which involves the construction on the Integrated Teaching Complex and an auditorium for Kabul University. 

On October 10, 2017, the commencement ceremony of the construction of the comprehensive teaching building and auditorium of Kabul University in Afghanistan was held in Kabul, the capital of Afghanistan. 

The Kabul University Comprehensive Teaching Building and Auditorium Project includes an academic lecture hall with 40 classrooms and an auditorium with a capacity of 500 people. It covers a total building area of about 14,100 m2, of which the comprehensive teaching building covers 8,350 m2, the auditorium covers 5,200m2, and the equipment room covers 550 m2. Its contents mainly include the major structures of the buildings, building decorations, an electricity system, a water drainage and supply system, an air-conditioning ventilation system, teaching office equipment installation, indoor furniture and appliances, and outdoor engineering. Upon completion, it will be the largest building of Kabul University. 

China 19th Metallurgical Corporation (MCC19) is the contractor responsible for project implementation. A project commencement ceremony took place on October 10, 2017. Then, the project passed its mid-term acceptance inspection on December 11, 2018. According to the media report issued by MOFCOM, until August 23, 2019, the project was still under the implementation status. 

For another project Chinese government grant for Kabul University, see #53632 for details.

STAFF_NOTE: The Chinese project title is 援阿喀布尔大学综合教学楼和礼堂项目, 喀布尔大学礼堂 or 阿富汗喀布尔大学综合教学楼和礼堂项.” This project is located at Kabul University. The locational coordinates of Kabul University are available at https://www.google.com/maps/place/Kabul+University/@34.5173801,69.1337345,17z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m5!3m4!1s0x38d16f2c550c3f59:0xa47b5d537e5b7214!8m2!3d34.5173801!4d69.1359232.
name: Kabul City

title: China Grants 712.6 million AFA to Afghan Ministry of Foreign Affairs (linked to #53879)
description: On November 4, 2008, China provided 712.6 million AFA to the Afghan Ministry of Foreign Affairs. From November 20, 2008, to December 21, 2019, China provides 858,140,268 Afghanistan Afghani (approx. 16.4 million USD) aids to Afghan Ministry of Foreign Affairs. The contribution was delivered over multiple years. About 97 million AFA (1.5 million USD) was spent. The funds were given in a grant used for acquisition of assets and the use of goods and services (#53879). DAD Platform Refer Project Code: AFG/230069; Old Project Code: AFG/0866901
name: Kabul City

title: Chinese Government provides RMB 180 million grant for National Vocational and Technical College Project
description:
In 2017, the Chinese Government and the Government of Afghanistan signed an MOU related to the National Vocational and Technical College Project. The MoU was signed by the Afghan Education Minister and the Economic Attaché for the Embassy of China in Kabul. The Bureau for International Economic Cooperation within China’s Ministry of Commerce committed RMB 180 million of grant funding for this project. 

The project involved the construction a new general building, the construction of an academic building with 65 classrooms, a dormitory, and a gymnasium; and the upgrading of an existing automobile repair laboratory. It has reportedly provided employment to 300 local residents. Upon completion, it was designed to serve up to 1,720 students. The National Vocational and Technical College was designed by SIPPR Engineering Group Co., Ltd (中国机械工业第六设计研究院有限公司) and constructed by China Railway 14th Construction Bureau Co Ltd. (中铁十四局). Construction began on April 12, 2017, and the project was completed in January 11, 2019. It successfully passed completion acceptance on March 10, 2019. 

The Chinese project title is 阿富汗职业技术学院项目.
name: Kabul City

title: China Grant to Afghanistan Cricket Board for 'Cricket For All Program'
description: In 2016, the Chinese government agreed to be a donor to the Afghanistan Cricket Board to support the Cricket for All Program in the Nangarhar Province. Additional financiers are the Asian Development Bank, the Indian government, and the Afghanistan government. The total cost of the program is $5 million, however the commitment made by China is unclear. The current status of the project is unclear.
name: Nangarhar

title: Chinese Government provides $11.5 million grant for Phase I of the Parwan Water Conservancy Restoration Project (Linked to Project ID #69368, #34498)
description:
Chinese government reached an agreement with the Afghanistan side in May 2003 to aid the Parwan water conservancy project through grants.The restoration project was divided into two phases:

Phase-1 (captured by project ID #34509): On March 3, 2004, at the Chinese Embassy in Kabul, Chinese ambassador to Afghanistan, Sun Yuxi and Afghan Irrigation, Water Resources and Environment Minister Mohammad Yusuf Nooristani signed a grant agreement for Phase I of the Parwan Water Conservancy Restoration Project. The purpose of this project was to rehabilitate an irrigation canal in Parwan Province, which is one of the most agriculturally productive areas of Afghanistan. 

Jiangxi Water and Hydropower Construction Co., Ltd. (JWHC) was the contractor responsible for project implementation. The design of the project was finalized on July 6, 2003. Construction began in March 2004, and the project was completed and transferred to the Afghan authorities in October 2006. The total cost of the first phase of the project was $11.5 million, according to the Shanghai Commerce Council. 

The design of the project was finalized on July 6, 2003. Construction began in March 2004, and the project was completed and transferred to the Afghan authorities in October 2006. The total cost of the first phase of the project was $11.5 million, according to the Shanghai Commerce Council. 

Phase-2 (captured by project ID # 69368): In 2010, the Chinese Government committed grant funding for Phase II of the Parwan Water Conservancy Restoration Project. The purpose of this project was to rehabilitate an irrigation canal in Parwan Province, which is one of the most agriculturally productive areas of Afghanistan. It involved enlarging the main canal, constructing additional gutters and retaining walls, and building fences around the Charikar pumping station and the Parwan Authority office. The total reported cost of this project is RMB 23 million. 

Jiangxi Water and Hydropower Construction Co., Ltd. (JWHC) was the contractor responsible for project implementation. Project implementation began on December 31, 2010. The project was completed on June 15, 2012, and the formal project handover ceremony took place on August 15, 2012. Staff Note: The Chinese project title is 阿富汗帕尔旺水利增项工程 or 阿富汗帕尔旺水利工程修复（二期. For the time being, we assume that the full cost of the project (RMB 23 million) was the value of the grant funding provided by the Chinese Government. 

In a news article published by the Chinese Embassy Website, the funding for the project was drawn from the US$150 million that China has pledged in 2002 and is a sub-umbrella project of #34498.

STAFF_NOTE: The Chinese project title is 阿富汗帕尔旺水利增项工程 or 成援阿富汗帕尔旺水利工程修复（一期). For the time being, we assume that the full cost of the project ($11.5 million) was the value of the grant funding provided by the Chinese Government. The main (85.578 km) irrigation canal was originally constructed with a grant from the Chinese Government in the late 1960s and 1970s. Construction was initiated on December 31, 1968 and completed on December 31, 1976. It was designed to irrigate 24,800 hectares (or 372,000 acres) of land. However, due to the effects of war and wear and tear, the irrigation canal fell into a state of disrepair and was unable to supply water in a reliable and effective manner.
name: Parwan

title: Chinese Government provides RMB 23 million grant for Phase II of the Parwan Water Conservancy Restoration Project (Linked to Project ID #34509, #34498)
description:
In 2010, the Chinese Government committed grant funding for Phase II of the Parwan Water Conservancy Restoration Project. The purpose of this project was to rehabilitate an irrigation canal in Parwan Province, which is one of the most agriculturally productive areas of Afghanistan. It involved enlarging the main canal, constructing additional gutters and retaining walls, and building fences around the Charikar pumping station and the Parwan Authority office. The total reported cost of this project is RMB 23 million. 

Jiangxi Water and Hydropower Construction Co., Ltd. (JWHC) was the contractor responsible for project implementation. Project implementation began on December 31, 2010. The project was completed on June 15, 2012, and the formal project handover ceremony took place on August 15, 2012. 

The main (85.578 km) irrigation canal was originally constructed with a grant from the Chinese Government in the late 1960s and 1970s. Construction was initiated on December 31, 1968 and completed on December 31, 1976. It was designed to irrigate 24,800 hectares (or 372,000 acres) of land. However, due to the effects of war and wear and tear, the irrigation canal fell into a state of disrepair and was unable to supply water in a reliable and effective manner.

Phase-1 of the Parwan Conservancy project is recorded in #34509. In a news article published by the Chinese Embassy Website, the funding for the project was drawn from the US$150 million that China has pledged in 2002 and is a sub-umbrella project of #34498.

STAFF_NOTE: The Chinese project title is 阿富汗帕尔旺水利增项工程 or 阿富汗帕尔旺水利工程修复（二期. For the time being, we assume that the full cost of the project (RMB 23 million) was the value of the grant funding provided by the Chinese Government.
name: Parwan

title: China donates 2m RMB for schools for war orphans in Afghanistan
description: In March 2003, China donated 2,000,000 RMB for the construction of two schools for war orphans in Afghanistan. The money was given to the Chinese Embassy in Afghanistan. The fund comes from donation initiated by 'Window of the World' Magazine in November 2002. On 17 June 2003, in Kabul, Afghan Education Minister Mohammad Yunus Qanooni and Chinese Ambassador to Afghanistan Sun Yuxi signed an agreement on the construction of the 2 schools- one in Kabul and another in Parwan. The construction would be implemented and monitored by the Chinese Embassy. The two schools were completed in September and October 2003. As of 2009, the 'friendship' schools had 2400 students.
name: Parwan

title: China grants emergency aid worth 30 million RMB to support interim regime in Afghanistan (Linked to #37850, #34501, #34498)
description: In January 2002, Chinese President Jiang Zemin, Prime Minister Zhu Rongji signed an agreement to provide Afghanistan emergency aid package worth 30 million Chinese Yuan during the visit of Afghan interim leader Hamid Karzai. The aid package includes medicine, medical equipment, stationery, and sports products is for support of the temporary government. In March 2002, Northern Afghanistan was hit by Hindu Kush earthquakes, so part of the aid was also used for rehabilitation. The handover ceremony was held on March 26, 2002. The agreement was signed together with #37850, another assistance of 1 million USD in cash. For other 2002 earthquake response fund that China provided for Afghanistan, see #34501 for details. This project is part of a package of 2002-2005 China assistance to Afghanistan of 150 million USD reconstruction plan (#34498).
name: Bagram

title: China grants emergency aid worth 30 million RMB to support interim regime in Afghanistan (Linked to #37850, #34501, #34498)
description: In January 2002, Chinese President Jiang Zemin, Prime Minister Zhu Rongji signed an agreement to provide Afghanistan emergency aid package worth 30 million Chinese Yuan during the visit of Afghan interim leader Hamid Karzai. The aid package includes medicine, medical equipment, stationery, and sports products is for support of the temporary government. In March 2002, Northern Afghanistan was hit by Hindu Kush earthquakes, so part of the aid was also used for rehabilitation. The handover ceremony was held on March 26, 2002. The agreement was signed together with #37850, another assistance of 1 million USD in cash. For other 2002 earthquake response fund that China provided for Afghanistan, see #34501 for details. This project is part of a package of 2002-2005 China assistance to Afghanistan of 150 million USD reconstruction plan (#34498).
name: Baghlan

title: China provides Afghanistan 13 million Yuan for emergency assistance and uniforms
description: In 2002, China provides 13 million Chinese Yuan (equivalent to 4 million USD) to Afghanistan for emergency assistance as well as other aids. The fund was delivered in March 2002. The fund was used deliver medical supplies, stationary (80,000 pieces) and uniforms for the army (50,000 pieces) and police (20,000 pieces), 30 computers to Ministry of Foreign Affairs. Part of the medicine was utilized in the north during the crises of Nahreen Earthquake. The fund is fully disbursed and used by 2006. DAD platform referral code: DAD/000357. STAFF_NOTE: This Project is not affiliated to #34498 because the transaction amounts and currency are separate.
name: Nahrin

title: China provides $1 million China Regional Cooperation and Poverty Reduction Fund for Afghanistan Energy Supply Improvement Investment Program (Tranche 2)
description:
On 20 December 2016, Asian Development Bank (ADB) signed the grant agreement to support Afghanistan Energy Supply Improvement Investment Program (Tranche 2), $1 million from People's Republic of China Regional Cooperation and Poverty Reduction Fund was planned to support the project. The Chinese funding was from ADB-administered People's Republic of China Funding (PRCF) Grant Agreement. PRC Fund resources will be disbursed first until its 100% utilization.

Afghanistan Energy Supply Improvement Investment Program (Tranche 2) is a co-financed project. The project is estimated to cost $420 million in total. It will be financed by Asian Development Bank (ADB) through (i) a grant from its Special Fund resources ($188.23 million), (ii) Afghanistan Infrastructure Trust Fund [AITF] ($225.77 million), and (iii) the People’s Republic of China Regional Cooperation and Poverty Reduction Fund [PRCF] ($1 million), both Funds to be administered by ADB, and Government of Afghanistan ($5 million equivalent). 

Da Afghanistan Breshna Sherkat (DABS) will be the executing agency. The project was estimated to be implemented from January 2017 to December 2022. The Multitranche Financing Facility (MFF) availability period will end on 31 December 2025. The project outputs will be (i) a new 500-MW high-voltage direct current back to back voltage source converter station commissioned at Dashte Alwan, (ii) a new 180 km of 220-kV transmission line commissioned from Doshi to Bamyan, and (iii) a new 220-kV/20-kV substation at Bamyan with a distribution network of 3,000 km and 20,000 new connections. The impact of tranche 2 will be improved access to sustainable energy supplies across Afghanistan, in line with the targets of the National Energy Supply Program of the Government of Afghanistan. The outcome will be increased supply of imported and indigenous power.

Afghanistan Energy Supply Improvement Investment Program (Tranche 2) is a sub-project under Afghanistan Energy Supply Improvement Investment Program, which was approved by ADB on 15 December 2015 and included 5 tranches seperately. 

The grant from China is administered by ADB. The proceeds of all grants in the project will be re-lent to DABS by the government on terms acceptable to ADB, including a financing period of 32 years, an 8-year grace period, an interest rate of 1% per annum during the grace period and 1.5% per annum thereafter.
name: Puli Khumri

The Chinese funding was from ADB-administered People's Republic of China Funding (PRCF) Grant Agreement. PRC Fund resources will be disbursed first until its 100% utilization.

Afghanistan Energy Supply Improvement Investment Program (Tranche 2) is a co-financed project. The project is estimated to cost $420 million in total. It will be financed by Asian Development Bank (ADB) through (i) a grant from its Special Fund resources ($188.23 million), (ii) Afghanistan Infrastructure Trust Fund [AITF] ($225.77 million), and (iii) the People’s Republic of China Regional Cooperation and Poverty Reduction Fund [PRCF] ($1 million), both Funds to be administered by ADB, and Government of Afghanistan ($5 million equivalent). 

Da Afghanistan Breshna Sherkat (DABS) will be the executing agency. The project was estimated to be implemented from January 2017 to December 2022. The Multitranche Financing Facility (MFF) availability period will end on 31 December 2025. The project outputs will be (i) a new 500-MW high-voltage direct current back to back voltage source converter station commissioned at Dashte Alwan, (ii) a new 180 km of 220-kV transmission line commissioned from Doshi to Bamyan, and (iii) a new 220-kV/20-kV substation at Bamyan with a distribution network of 3,000 km and 20,000 new connections. The impact of tranche 2 will be improved access to sustainable energy supplies across Afghanistan, in line with the targets of the National Energy Supply Program of the Government of Afghanistan. The outcome will be increased supply of imported and indigenous power.

Afghanistan Energy Supply Improvement Investment Program (Tranche 2) is a sub-project under Afghanistan Energy Supply Improvement Investment Program, which was approved by ADB on 15 December 2015 and included 5 tranches seperately. 

The grant from China is administered by ADB. The proceeds of all grants in the project will be re-lent to DABS by the government on terms acceptable to ADB, including a financing period of 32 years, an 8-year grace period, an interest rate of 1% per annum during the grace period and 1.5% per annum thereafter.
name: Bamyan City

title: China to write off Bangladeshi unpaid interest in a gesture of friendship
description: At a Joint Commission (JC) meeting between Bangladesh and China in 2009, China agreed to write off unpaid interest on loans given to Bangladesh until the end of 2008. The exact amount that was written off was not specified.
name: Bangladesh

title: China Grants 82 Million RMB to Bangladesh for Vehicle Container Inspection Systems
description: On May 24, 2015, under an Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreement (ETCA), China signed two Letters of Exchange amounting to an 82 Million RMB grant to Bangladesh to procure 4 sets of Vehicle Mobile Container Inspection systems for the National Board of Review(NBR) under the Internal Resources Division, Ministry of Finance. The purpose of the vehicle Inspection system is to reduce the inspection time of import and export goods, therefore increasing the efficiency of custom officials and decreasing the trading cost of business. The system will also help to reduce tax evasion. The scanners will be installed in customs houses in Chittagong and Mongla seaports and Benapole, the country's largest land-port on the Indo-Bangladesh border, and Inland Container Depot (ICD) at Kamalapur in the capital of Dhaka. The handover ceremony took place on May 11, 2016.
name: Bangladesh

title: China donates relief commodities worth of 7 million RMB to Bangladesh for flood rehabilitation (Linked to Project ID #34297)
description: Members of a four-person Chinese delegation to Bangladesh told the Secretary of Food and Disaster Management Siddiqur Rahman Chowdhury that the Chinese government would donate seven million RMB in corrugated iron sheets for the flood rehabilitation program. Chinese Ambassador to Bangladesh Chi Xi handed over the consignment to Food and Disaster Management Secretary Siddiqur Rahman on Dec 22, 2004.
name: Bangladesh

title: China grants 46 Government Scholarships to Bangladesh Students for AY 2006/2007
description: In August 2006, China awarded 46 Government Scholarships for Bangladesh students to study in China.
name: Bangladesh

title: China signs 500 Million RMB ETCA Grant with Government of Bangladesh
description: On October 14, 2016, the Government of China and the Government of Bangladesh under President Md. Abdul Hamid and the Prime Minister, Sheikh Hasina, signed an Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreement (ETCA) grant worth 500 Million RMB. The exact allocation for this ETCA is unknown. This was part of Chinese President Xi Jinping's visit to Bangladesh and which included the signing of 27 deals.
name: Bangladesh

title: China to grant Government Scholarship to 43 Bangladeshi students in 2015-2016
description: For the academic year of 2015-2016, 43 Chinese Government Scholarships will be made available for students from Bangladesh.
name: Bangladesh

title: Assistance for dredging of riverbeds and for capacity building through training of personnel
description: In 2008, China and Bangladesh signed an MoU on sustainable cooperation on hydrological data sharing and flood control of river Yarluzangbu/Brahmaputra, in mitigating the magnitude and frequency flood disasters in Bangladesh. In 2010, this extended to strengthening cooperation on water resources management, hydrological data sharing, flood control and disaster reduction, as well as an agreement for China to dredge riverbeds and increase workforce capacity via personnel training. The two sides agreed to carry out sustainable cooperation on hydrological data sharing and flood control of river Yarluzangbu/Brahmaputra, in view of its necessity to the disaster reduction in Bangladesh. The two sides agreed to strengthen cooperation on water resources management, hydrological data sharing, flood control and disaster reduction, based on the exchange of letters between the Ministries of Water Resources of the two countries in 2005. At the request of the Bangladesh side, the Chinese side agreed to provide assistance for dredging of riverbeds and for capacity building through training of personnel.
name: Bangladesh

title: China grants 32 Government Scholarships to Bangladesh students for AY 2012/2013
description: In August 2012, China awarded 32 Government Scholarships for Bangladesh students to study in China.
name: Bangladesh

title: China grants 117 Government Scholarships to Bangladeshi students for AY2013/2014 (Link to #38326)
description: In 2013, 117 Bangladeshis were awarded the Chinese Government Scholarship to study in China for the academic year 2013/14. Further details are unknown.
name: Bangladesh

title: Chinese embassy donates 1 million taka for Bangladeshi flood victims
description: In 2007, the Chinese ambassador to Bangladesh donated 1.01 million taka to the Bangladeshi government as part of flood relief efforts.
name: Bangladesh

title: China provides Wushu equipment and training to Bangladesh
description: In 2010, China offered Bangladesh technical and equipment assistance relating to Wushu. Two Chinese coaches were sent over to Bangladesh to train their wushu athletes for the upcoming South Asian Games. This was in addition to the wushu equipment donated by China.
name: Bangladesh

title: China donates education and assistive devices to Impact Foundation Bangladesh
description: On November 21, 2012, Li Jun,Chinese ambassador to Bangladesh, donated education and assistive devices for persons with disabilities through the Impact Foundation Bangladesh.
name: Bangladesh

title: China Eximbank provies RMB 1.042 billion government concessional loan for Phase III of Info-Sarker Project(Linked to Project ID #34340)
description:
In 2017, China Eximbank and the Government of Bangladesh signed an RMB 1,042,830,000 government concessional loan (GCL) agreement for the Phase III of the Info-Sarker Project. The GCL carried the following terms: 2% interest rate, 20-year maturity, and 5 year grace period. The Government of Bangladesh loan identification number for this China Eximbank GCL is L1120171027A. Phase III of the Info-Sarker Project sought to extend the fiber-optic broadband network ‚Äî more specifically, the 1 Gbps ring-based Dense Wavelength Division Multiplexing (DWDM) network ‚Äî by 19,500 km to 2,600 unions and 1,000 police stations. 

As of early 2020, the implementation of this project was still underway.  Bikarna Kumar Ghosh, the Director of Phase III of the Info-Sarker Project, announced that more than 100 million people would ultimately benefit from the internet connectivity after the completion of the project. He also predicted that the project would increase national GDP by 1%.

See Project #34340 for Phase II of the Info-Sarker project, also financed by China Exim Bank.
name: Bangladesh

title: China Eximbank provides $211 million loan for 3G Technology and Expansion of 2.5G Network Project
description:
In September 2006, the Chinese Government pledged to provide a $211 million concessional loan to the Bangladeshi state-run mobile operator Teletalk but the deal expired without any loan agreement finalized by August 2008. However, in 2009, China pledged to renew the deal and the proceeds of the loan were to be used to upgrade Bangladesh's telephone networks to 3G, via Teletalk. TeleTalk, Bangladesh, Ltd. was selected to implement the project under the supervision of the Ministry of Post and Telecommunication, and it was expected that the project would increase TeleTalk's capacity to provide service to 4.73 million new 3G subscribers and 4.77 million new 2.5G GSM mobile subscribers. 

The originally planned completion date of the project was July 2010. However, the pipeline project encountered various delays. On December 27, 2010, Teletalk and CMEC signed a contract for the Bangladesh 2.5G Network Expansion and 3G New Construction Project with a total contract value of $216 million. Then, on June 9, 2011, China Eximbank and the Government of Bangladesh signed a $211 million loan agreement for the 3G Technology and Expansion of 2.5G Network Project.  The loan carried the following terms: 2% interest rate, 19-year maturity, 4 year grace period, and 0.2% commitment fee. The Government of Bangladesh's loan identification number for the China Eximbank GCL is B1120110609a. 

Teletalk‚Äôs CMEC contract became effective June 9, 2011, and construction officially commenced on January 6, 2012. Then, on October 15, 2012, Bangladeshi Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina inaugurated the 3G network. As of 2015, this project was completed and Teletalk reportedly saw significant increases in revenues and subscribers. 

STAFF_NOTE: This project is also known as the "Modernization and Expansion of Teletalk's 2G/3G Network of to Rural Areas (MEP).
name: Bangladesh

title: China Grant 560,000 RMB for Road Transport Network Feasibility Study
description: On June 12, 2017, China committed to grant 560,000 RMB to the Government of Bangladesh to fund a Feasibility Study of the Project of Planning the Road Transport Network of Bangladesh. The project is in pipeline stage, as no sources have reported whether the project has been completed or not.
name: Bangladesh

title: China signs a memorandum of understanding on water conservancy with Bangladesh
description: Officials and experts from the water conservancy departments of the Chinese and Bangladeshi governments exchanged visits and signed an MOU with regards to technological cooperation on water conservancy. Specific cooperation projects included dike arrangement and sectional design for the Brahmaputra River, regulating the River's watercourses and joint research on the River's watercourses and silt movement. In 2015, China began giving Bangladesh flow data on the Brahmaputra river. This has helped Bangladesh in flood forecasting and emergency response efforts.
name: Bangladesh

title: Chinese Government provides debt forgiveness worth RMB 600 million
description: In August 2011, the Chinese Government exempted the Government of Bangladesh from repaying the outstanding debts associated with 9 interest-free loans (collectively worth RMB 600 million or approximately $94.92 million) after they entered their planned repayment periods on December 31, 2010. Five of the nine interest-free loans were previously committed via Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreements (ECTAs) and four of these interest-free loans were previously committed via military aid agreements.
name: Bangladesh

title: China donates 6,004 pieces of agricultural equipment to Bangladesh
description: In April 2017, the Chinese Ambassador to Bangladesh, Ma Mingqiang, handed over the donation of 6,004 pieces of farming equipment to the Bangladesh government. The grant of equipment was said to be part of a movement to modernize Bangladesh's agricultural sector. STAFF_NOTE: No information about the commitment date could be found.
name: Bangladesh

title: China donates meteorological satellite receivers to Bangladesh (Linked to #35301)
description: In 2006, China donated Fengyun receivers to Bangladesh (among other countries) to integrate it into the Fengyun satellite system, enabling it to receive signals from weather satellites. The system receives real-time data from Chinese and international meteorological satellites and broadcasts the information to the countries. The satellite network will also serve to better integrate the recipient countries with China. This project is linked to #35301, in which China trained satellite receiver operators.
name: Bangladesh

title: China donates bullet proof helmets and vests to Bangladesh police
description: In March 2006, China handed over security gear (bullet proof vests and helmets) to the Bangladeshi police as a gesture of friendship. The handover took place between the Chinese Ambassador of Dhaka, Chai Xi, and Bangladesh State Minister for Home Affairs, Lutfozzaman Babar.
name: Bangladesh

title: China Eximbank provides RMB 1.2 billion government concessional loan for Procurement of 6 Oil Vessels Project (Linked to Project ID #55046 and #38342)
description:
On November 14, 2016, China Eximbank and the Government of Bangladesh signed an RMB 1,200,000,000 government concessional loan (GCL) agreement for the  Procurement of 6 Oil Vessels Project.  The GCL carried the following terms: 2% interest rate, 20-year maturity, a grace period of 5 years. The Government of Bangladesh's loan identification number for the China Eximbank GCL is L1120161014A. 

The purpose of the project was for Bangladesh Shipping Corporation (BSC) to purchase 3 bulk oil tankers and 3 oil carriers from the China National Machinery Import and Export Corporation. Each ship will have a load of 39,000 tons. The 3 new bulk oil tankers and 3 oil carriers were built by the Yangzijiang Shipbuilding (Holdings) Ltd. for the Bangladesh Shipping Corporation (BSC), and they were expected to be delivered in 2018 to join the BSC's existing fleet of 8 ships. The keel laying for the first vessel was concluded on January 30, 2018. The second vessel ‚Äî a bulk oil tanker ‚Äî was launched from the slipway of New Yangzi shipyard on June 14, 2018. Two additional vessels were launched on July 25, 2018. Another vessel was launched on February 2, 2018. On January 22, 2019, a 39000DWT tanker was successfully delivered to BSC.  

STAFF_NOTE: This project is also known as the 'Purchase of 6 Oil Ships Project'.  Given that the sixth vessel was successfully delivered to BSC on January 22, 2019, we status-code this project as complete and set the date to January 22, 2019.
name: Bangladesh

title: China provides 500 miillion RMB grant for 1,000 fire department motorcycles
description:
On October 14, 2016, China committed to grant 500 million RMB (approximately $73.29 million) for the modernization of Bangladesh's Fire Service and Civil Defence. The financial and technical cooperation agreement was signed during President Xi Jinping‚Äôs visit to Bangladesh, and is said to be part of the project of Disaster Emergency Operation Centre and Information Platform. The grant will provide for 1000 ‚Äòwater mist fire motorcycles‚Äô fitted with modern technologies. The motorcycles will be able to maneuver through Dhaka's crowded streets.

title: China to conduct hybrid rice technology training program for agricultural technicians in Bangladesh
description: On May 17, 2008, an opening ceremony for a hybrid rice technology training program funded by the Ministry of Science and Technology was held in Bangladesh. The one-month training program will involve technological training for over 30 Bangladesh agricultural technicians.

title: China provides agricultural training to Bangladesh (Linked to #33993)
description: In 2009, over 100 Bangladeshis participated in a training program held in China for agriculture and climate change industries. Since 2005, roughly 397 Bangladeshi officials as well as those in technical and economic positions have trained in China, as part of the 2005 MoU on Cooperation in the Field of Agriculture between the Ministry of Agriculture of China and the Ministry of Agriculture of Bangladesh. Project is linked to #33993.

title: China Grants Debt Relief to Bangladesh for Interest Free Loan Due in 2008
description: During a state visit to China from March 17-21, 2010, the Bangladeshi Prime Minister, Sheikh Hasina, the Chinese President, Hu Jintao, and the Chinese Premier, Wen Jiabao, signed the Protocol on Remitting the Bangladesh Interest-free Loan due in 2008. This agreement was signed along with an Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreement, Framework Agreement on Providing Preferential Loans, and Exchange of Letters on the Construction of the Seventh Bangladesh-China Friendship Bridge. The exact amount of the loan is unknown.

title: China grants 67 Government Scholarships to Bangladeshi students for AY2014/2015 (Link to #38326, #38327)

title: China grants Tk 354 million for medical equipment and appliances
description:
In 2015, AMA Muhith, Bangladesh's Finance Minister, and Gao Hucheng, China‚Äôs commerce minister, signed two Letters of Exchange (LEs). In one letter China pledged to collect medical equipments and appliances for the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The funding came from a Chinese grant of Tk 35.4 crore (TK 354 million).

The coder did follow-up research in both English and Chinese, but could not find any  information relating to the progress of the project. Unsure if transaction ever occured.

title: Chinese embassy donates office equipment to Bangladesh
description: In 2013, the Chinese embassy donated office equipment to Impact Foundation Bangladesh, a voluntary organization. The handover occurred between Chinese ambassador Li Jun and acting director of Impact Foundation Bangladesh, Pradip Sengupta.

title: 50 scholarships for Bangladeshi students under MoU on cultural exchange
description: In 2002, Bangladesh and Chinese governments on Thursday signed an executive program for cultural exchanges between the two countries for the years of 2001 to 2003.This is an implementation program of the Agreement of Cooperation on Culture between Bangladesh and China, which was signed in November 1979. It was renewed in 2003 - the Executive Program on Cultural Agreement between Bangladesh and China. This was later extended again from 2004-2008 and then again from 2009-2012. According to the executive program, the two countries will exchange visits of performing art groups and delegations of cultural officials, artists. The two sides will also encourage exchanges and cooperation in the fields of culture, press and publication, education and sports. Besides, the Chinese government will offer scholarships for 50 Bangladesh undergraduate and postgraduate students annually, compared with 40 in previous executive program.
name: Bangladesh

title: China donates US$100,000 to Bangladesh for flood rehabilitation (Linked to Project ID #34298)
description: A Chinese delegation presented the Food and Disaster Management minister, Chowdhury Kamal Ibne Yousuf, a cheque for 100,000 US dollars. They also agreed to donate corrugated iron sheets worth Tk 6 crore to help with flood relief.
name: Bangladesh

title: Chinese Agricultural Experts Assist Bangladesh Agriculturalists
description: In 2017, Chinese Ambassador to Bangladesh Ma Mingqiang noted that eight Chinese agricultural experts were in Bangladesh. The experts were working with Bangladeshi farmers with the cultivation of hybrid rice. It is unclear which organization these experts came from. STAFF_NOTE: This project assumes that the consultants were sent by the Chinese government and that Bangladesh did not pay for their services.
name: Bangladesh

title: Chinese EXIM Bank provides 1.2 billion RMB worth of Export Credits to Bangladesh to Purchase 6 Oil Ships(linked to #52873)
description: On November 14, 2016 the signed a deal with the Bangladesh Shipping Corporation to provide 1,200,000,000 RMB of Export Credits for the purchase of 6 ships from the China National Machinery Import and Export Corporation. The export credits have a 2% interest rate, 5 year grace period, and 20 year maturity. The 3 new bulk oil tankers and 3 oil carriers are being built by the Yangzijiang Shipbuilding Co, and are expected to be delivered in 2018 to join the BSC's existing fleet of 8 ships. According to the 2016 ODA Report from the Economic Relations Division of Bangladesh, only 180m RMB of the total committed amount has been dispersed. STAFF_NOTE: CRS Sector 32262
name: Bangladesh

title: China trains Bangladeshi satellite receiver operators (linked to #34057)
description: In 2006, China Space Administration presented the Chinese-made Fengyun series of high-quality meteorological satellites and its services to Bangladesh and six other Asian Pacific countries for use in 'meteorological research, disaster mitigation, economic growth and prosperity.' The system receives real-time data from Chinese and international meteorological satellites and broadcasts the information to the countries. China and the seven countries signed a convention on space co-operation in October 2007 as the precursor to establishing the Asia-Pacific Space Co-operation Organization (APSCO) in Beijing, an inter-governmental organization to facilitate international alliances for the peaceful use of space. China ran training courses for staff from the APSCO member states to help them use the system and to realize the co-operation proposed by the convention. Specific details on the training are unavailable. This project is linked to #34057.
name: Bangladesh

title: CNMIEC provides $74.5 million supplier‚Äôs credit for Rehabilitation, Renovation and Augmentation of 29 Grid Sub-Stations Project
description:
On April 25, 2000, China National Electric Wire & Cable Import/Export Corporation (CNMIEC) provided a $74.523 million supplier‚Äôs credit for the Rehabilitation, Renovation, and Augmentation of 29 Grid Sub-Stations Project. The supplier‚Äôs credit carried the following terms: 16-year maturity, 3 year grace period, and a 3.5% interest rate. The Government of Bangladesh issued a sovereign guarantee for this loan on July 27, 2000.  CNMIEC secured the funding to provide the supplier‚Äôs credit from an RMB 580 million export seller‚Äôs credit from China Eximbank. The Government of Bangladesh‚Äôs loan identification number for the supplier‚Äôs credit is S1120000425a. According to the Government of Bangladesh‚Äôs Economic Relations Division (ERD), $74.523 million had been disbursed through this supplier‚Äôs credit and nothing had been repaid to the creditor as of June 30, 2018.  

The purpose of this project was to rehabilitate 29 grid substations and 819 kilometers of 132-kilovolt transmission lines and increase their capacity from 1100 to 2000 megawatts.  CNMIEC was the contractor responsible for project implementation. Construction work began in October 2005, and the project was successfully completed and handed over to the Bangladesh Power Development Board in February 2007.

title: China donates $1 million USD to Bangladesh for disaster relief following the 2007 cyclone
description: On 15 November 2007, cyclone Sidr produced widespread flooding and damage in Bangladesh. In response, on 19 November 2007, the Chinese Ambassador to Bangladesh met with a Bangladeshi foreign advisor and pledged $1 million USD for emergency disaster relief efforts. The United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) Financial Tracking Service captures this donation in flow ID #50412.
