title: China National Electric Wire & Cable Import & Export Corporation gives 1.45 billion BDK suppliers credit for Bogra-Barapukuria 230 KV Transmission Line Project
description: In 2005 the Power Grid Company of Bangladesh (PGCB) received 1.45 billion BDK of supplier's credit from China National Electric Wire & Cable Import & Export Corporation for the Bogra-Barapukuria 230 KV Transmission Line Project. The Government of Bangladesh provided a sovereign guarantee for this supplier's credit on April 28, 2005. China National Electric Wire and Cable Import and Export Corporation (CNEWC) will be implementing the project (Contract No. PGCB/SC/011). The project began in 2003 and was finished in November 2005.
name: Bogra

title: Bank of Communications lends 50 Million USD as part of a syndicated loan for the Chapainawabganj 100MW Heavy Fuel Oil (HFO) Power Project
description:
On May 25, 2015, a $112 million loan agreement between the Bangladesh Power Development Board (BPDB), HSBC, and Bank of Communications was signed. Bank of Communications reportedly contributed a $50 million export buyer's credit to this loan syndicate. The loan reportedly has a 12-year maturity, a two-year grace period, and a sovereign guarantee from the Government of Bangladesh. The loan covers 100% of the EPC costs and comes with full ECA cover from Finnvera and Sinosure. Associated costs and expenses have been financed under an uncovered facility. Finnvera is covering a total of $46.9 million with Sinosure guaranteeing the remainder. Both guarantees effectively reinsure a 100% sovereign guarantee from the Bangladeshi government, which owns BPDB. China Export & Credit Insurance Corporation was the accountable party of the credit agreement. 

The proceeds of the loan are being used to finance the EPC contract and turbine procurement from Hubei Electric Power Survey and Design Institute and Wartsila Finland. The $131 million project is sponsored by Bangladesh Power Development Board (BPDB) and it involves around $47 million for 12 Wartsila 20V32 heavy fuel oil engines, with the remainder covering EPC costs generated by Hubei Electric Power Survey and Design Institute, which is building the plant under a 450-day turnkey EPC contract and is providing a two-year warranty and a four-year service and maintenance contract. 

Although the plant came with a relatively high generation cost (Tk21.70 per kilowatt-hour [kWh] as compared with between Tk6.0 and Tk18 per kWh for other Bangladeshi HFO plants), the project has significant political backing as it is part of Bangladesh‚Äôs Power System Master Plan 2010 and will help improve the overall electricity supply to export processing zones that have been established in the north-west of the country. Implementation of this project began in May of 2015. This power plant was successfully connected to the grid on or around April 13, 2017. 

Detailed locational coordinates for this power plant can be found at https://www.google.com/maps/place/Chapainawabganj+100+M.W+Peaking+Power+Plant/@24.6321421,88.3992529,17z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m5!3m4!1s0x39fbbc0a7244d0cf:0x6357334104b0e1b9!8m2!3d24.6321372!4d88.4014416.

STAFF_NOTE: The Chinese project title is Â≠üÂä†ÊãâÂõΩËØ∫Áì¶Â∏ÉÁîòÊù∞ÈáçÊ≤πÁîµÂéÇÈ°πÁõÆ. One source identifies the borrower as Bangladesh Power Development Board (BPDB). However, since this project appears to have been implemented as an independent power project (IPP), it is possible that this source is incorrect and the borrower of the loan was a project company (special purpose vehicle).
name: Nawabganj

title: China Eximbank and Bank of China provide $119.4 million syndicated loan for 220MW Surajganj 2 Combined Cycle Dual Fuel Power Project (linked to #69033)
description:
On October 10, 2015, China Eximbank and Bank of China signed a $119.4 million syndicated loan agreement with North-West Power Generation Company Limited for Unit 2 of the 220MW Sirajganj Combined Cycle Power Plant Project (also known as the Sirajganj 2 Project). Northwest Power Generation Company Limited is a state-owned power and electric company in Bangladesh. It is a 100% subsidiary of Bangladesh Power Development Board. The loan reportedly carries a 15-year maturity. It is insured by Sinosure and it received a sovereign guarantee from the Government of Bangladesh. 

The proceeds of the loan are to be used to finance part of the costs of goods and services under a turnkey EPC contract (signed on August 20, 2014) with China Machinery Import & Export Corporation (CMC) and Fujian Electric Power Survey & Design Institute (FEDI). $68.9 million in additional financing for the project followed in December 2015 when MIGA committed to a guarantee for the non-honoring of sovereign financial obligations against loans from Standard Chartered ($44 million) and Siemens Bank ($24.9 million). CMC is the consortium leader and will provide overall project management while FEDI will provide technical expertise, including concept design and basic engineering. The turbines will be supplied by Siemens AG (Germany). The same EPC team (CMC, FEDI, Siemens) was responsible for the construction, commissioning, and early operation of the first unit of electricity generators (‚ÄúSirajganj 1‚Äù). 

The Sirajganj 220MW Combined Cycle Power Plant is a major project under the Belt and Road Initiative (BRI). It involves the installation of 3 units of electricity generators, each of 225MW capacity. It is an expansion of the existing 150MW power plant on the Jamunja river. The proceeds of the 2015 syndicated loan from the Bank of China and the Export-Import Bank of China only supported the installation of the second unit of electricity generators (‚ÄúSirajganj 2‚Äù, which passed the final inspection tests in February 2018. The second unit of the power plant began commercial operations on February 5, 2018.  The project involved the construction, installation, and operation of a 225 MW dual-fuel CCPP (similar to Sirajganj 1) within the Sirajganj Power Complex, comprising a dual-fuel gas turbine, generator, steam turbine and a heat recovery steam generator (HRSG), water treatment and cooling system, as well as the construction of a 230 kV switchyard and an extension of the existing 230 kV switching station within the Sirajganj Power Complex. The project utilized the existing jetty for unloading heavy equipment, access roads, and water treatment and cooling systems that were constructed for Sirajganj 1. 

The project is located about 15 km south-east of Sirajganj town and 130 km north-west of Dhaka. The closest settlements to the project site, Boroshimul & Ponchosona, are both located approximately 1 km from the power plant complex. Natural gas, the main fuel for the project, will be supplied by Petrobangla, and there are already existing pipelines servicing the power plant complex for the Sirajganj 1 Project. Power from the project will be evacuated to the national grid through the existing 230kV switching station beside the project site. More detailed locational information can be found at https://www.google.com/maps/place/Sirajganj+225+MW+Combined+Cycle+Power+Plant+(Unit-2/@24.3856385,89.7443028,17z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m5!3m4!1s0x39fde9033eb445ad:0x7cd2833dda7a0b37!8m2!3d24.3856336!4d89.7464915 and https://www.nwpgcl.org.bd/current-plant/sirajganj-225-mw-combined-cycle-power-plant-unit-2-

STAFF_NOTE: This power plant is also known as the Sirajganj 3x225MW Combined Cycle Power Plant or the 220MW Surajganj Combined-Cycle Dual Fuel Power Project. The Chinese project title is Â≠üÂä†ÊãâÂõΩÂ∏åÊãâÁîòÊù∞220MWËÅîÂêàÂæ™ÁéØÁîµ Á´ôÈ°πÁõÆ. The Bangla project title is ‡¶∏‡¶ø‡¶∞‡¶æ‡¶ú‡¶ó‡¶û‡ßç‡¶ú ‡ß®‡ß®‡ß´ ‡¶Æ‡ßá‡¶É‡¶ì‡¶É ‡¶ï‡¶Æ‡ßç‡¶¨‡¶æ‡¶á‡¶®‡ßç‡¶° ‡¶∏‡¶æ‡¶á‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶≤ ‡¶¨‡¶ø‡¶¶‡ßç‡¶Ø‡ßÅ‡ßé ‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶®‡ßç‡¶¶‡ßç‡¶∞ (‡¶á‡¶â‡¶®‡¶ø‡¶ü-‡ß®).  The first unit of electricity generators (Sirajganj 1) was commissioned in 2012. Construction of the third unit of electricity generators (Sirajganj 3) began in October 2017, and it began commercial operations on January 20, 2019. Sirajganj 3 was supported by a syndicated loan that included the provision of debt from the Bank of China (see Project ID#69033).
name: Sirajganj

title: Syndicated loan for the Unit 3 of the 220MW Sirajganj Combined Cycle Power Plant Project (Linked to Project ID#56541)
description:
In 2017, a $196.7 million syndicated loan (involving Bank of China debt) was signed to North-West Power Generation Company Limited for Unit 3 of the 220MW Sirajganj Combined Cycle Power Plant Project (also known as the Sirajganj 3 Project). Northwest Power Generation Company Limited is a state-owned power and electric company in Bangladesh. It is a 100% subsidiary of Bangladesh Power Development Board. 

The transaction was structured as a long term loan with 15-year maturity split into 3 tranches: a $118.36 million Sinosure-insured loan tranche from Bank of China and Siemens Bank; a $34.03 million Euler Hermes-insured tranche from Deutsche Pfandbriefbank AG, and a $44.34 million commercial tranche with MIGA NHSFO insurance from Standard Charted Bank debt. The Government of Bangladesh (‚ÄúGOB‚Äù) provided a sovereign guarantee for debt service. The loan will cover 80% of the costs, with the other 20% coming from Northwest Power Generation Company Limited. 

China National Machinery Import and Export Corporation (‚ÄúCMC‚Äù) and Fujian Electric Power Survey and Design Institute (‚ÄúFEDI‚Äù) are the EPC contractors responsible for project implementation. Under the EPC contract, the contractors were required to commission the project within 2.5 years of the start date. Construction of the third unit of electricity generators (Sirajganj 3) began on October 19, 2017, and the plant began commercial operations on January 20, 2019. CMC and FEDI were also the contractors responsible for the implementation of the Bank of China and China Eximbank-financed Unit 2 of the 220MW Sirajganj Combined Cycle Power Plant Project. 

This project is linked to project #56541, the construction of the Surajganj 2 Power Plant, financed by China Eximbank and Bank of China.
name: Sirajganj

title: China National Electric Wire & Cable Import & Export Corporation gives 1.45 billion BDK suppliers credit for Bogra-Barapukuria 230 KV Transmission Line Project
description: In 2005 the Power Grid Company of Bangladesh (PGCB) received 1.45 billion BDK of supplier's credit from China National Electric Wire & Cable Import & Export Corporation for the Bogra-Barapukuria 230 KV Transmission Line Project. The Government of Bangladesh provided a sovereign guarantee for this supplier's credit on April 28, 2005. China National Electric Wire and Cable Import and Export Corporation (CNEWC) will be implementing the project (Contract No. PGCB/SC/011). The project began in 2003 and was finished in November 2005.
name: Dinajpur

title: CNMIEC provides $188.1 million supplier‚Äôs credit for  2x125 MW Barapukuria Coal-Fired Power Plant Project (Linked to Project ID #34237 and #52735)
description:
On June 30, 2001, China National Machinery Import and Export Corporation (CMC) provided a $188.1 million supplier‚Äôs credit to the Government of Bangladesh for the 2x125 MW Barapukuria Coal-Fired Power Plant Project. The supplier‚Äôs credit carried the following terms: 15-year maturity, 3 year grace period, and a 3.5% interest rate. The Government of Bangladesh issued a sovereign guarantee for this loan on September 8, 2002. The Government of Bangladesh‚Äôs loan identification number for this supplier's credit is S1120010630a. 

CMC secured the funding to provide the supplier‚Äôs credit from an export seller‚Äôs credit from China Eximbank. CMC was the contractor responsible for project implementation. Power plant construction began in November 2002. The first power generation unit was successfully put into operation in mid-November 2005, and the second power generation unit was put into operation in 2006. According to the Government of Bangladesh‚Äôs Economic Relations Division (ERD), $187.920 million had been disbursed through this supplier‚Äôs credit and $124.126 million had been repaid to the creditor as of June 30, 2018. The exact locational coordinates of the project are available at http://globalenergyobservatory.org/geoid/40466.

STAFF_NOTE: Some sources indicate that the contractor responsible for project implementation was China National Electric Wire & Cable Import/Export Corporation (CNMIEC) rather than CMC. China National Electric Wire & Cable Import/Export Corporation is now known as China National Cable Engineering Corporation.
name: Dinajpur

title: China National Electric Wire & Cable Import & Export Corporation gives 1.45 billion BDK suppliers credit for Bogra-Barapukuria 230 KV Transmission Line Project
description: In 2005 the Power Grid Company of Bangladesh (PGCB) received 1.45 billion BDK of supplier's credit from China National Electric Wire & Cable Import & Export Corporation for the Bogra-Barapukuria 230 KV Transmission Line Project. The Government of Bangladesh provided a sovereign guarantee for this supplier's credit on April 28, 2005. China National Electric Wire and Cable Import and Export Corporation (CNEWC) will be implementing the project (Contract No. PGCB/SC/011). The project began in 2003 and was finished in November 2005.
name: Gaibandha

title: Chinese Government provides RMB 9.35 million grant for construction of Chittagong Primary School and Rangpur Primary School
description:
In 2009, the Chinese Government and the Government of Bangladesh met at the 12th session of the Joint Commission (JC) and discussed the possibility of China providing assistance for building two primary schools. Bangladesh had initially sought assistance to build 5 schools. In September 2011, China Heilongjiang International Economic and Technical Cooperation Corporation and the Ministry of Primary and Mass Education of Bangladesh represented their respective governments and signed a contract to construct two rural primary schools with grant funding from the Chinese Government. 

Construction of the schools was expected to begin in November 2011 and to be completed within 15 months. The total contract amount was 9.35 million yuan. Chongqing Meilian International Warehouse and Transport Group Co Ltd were responsible for delivering essential construction items from China to Bangladesh for the construction of the schools. The items include steel, building materials, and construction equipment that weigh a total of 300 tons. 

The two rural primary schools are Chittagong Primary School, which has a total area of ‚Äã‚Äã1,030.40 square meters, and Rangpur Primary School, which covers a total area of ‚Äã‚Äã1056,69 meters. The construction was divided into two parts: teaching buildings and office buildings. Construction for Chittagong Primary School started on December 13, 2011, and was completed on August 20, 2012. Construction for Rangpur Primary School started on April 16, 2012, and was completed on September 15, 2012.
name: Rangpur

title: ICBC and China Eximbank provide $231.3 million for 330MW Shahjibazar Power Plant Project
description:
In June 2014, the Bangladesh Power Development Board (BPDB) signed a 13-year $257 million export credit agreement with a syndicated of banks in support of the 330 megawatt Shahjibazar Power Plant Project, which is located in Habiganj, Sylhet, Northeast of Bangladesh. In May 2013, Guangdong Power Engineering Corporation (GPEC) and the Guangdong Electric Power Design Institute (GEDI) of China Energy Engineering Group signed a Engineering, Procurement, and Construction (EPC) contract for this project. The British-based HSBC, China Eximbank, and Industrial and Commercial Bank of China (ICBC) formed a bank syndicated to fund 95% of the cost of the project. ICBC reportedly covered 55% of the cost, while China Eximbank and HSBC covered 35% and 10% of the cost, respectively. This record only reports the 90% of the $257 million ($231.3 million) that came from Chinese financiers. Sinosure provided insurance for this loan. The Government of Bangladesh projected a sovereign guarantee on April 15, 2014. 

The loan reportedly carried a 13 year maturity, but the interest rate and grace period are unknown. A project commencement ceremony took place on August 20, 2014. The power plant was then put into commercial operation on December 26, 2016. The exact coordinates of the project can be found at http://globalenergyobservatory.org/geoid/40464 and https://www.google.com/maps/place/Shahjibazar+330+MW+Power+Plant/@24.2594328,91.4604557,12z/data=!4m8!1m2!2m1!1sshahjibazar+power+plant!3m4!1s0x37515a0e72807cf7:0xd91502ce186c8302!8m2!3d24.2525208!4d91.3756155

Staff Note: The Chinese project title is Ê≤ôÂü∫Â∑¥ÊâéÁîµÁ´ôÊÄªË£ÖÊú∫300MW. One ICBC source indicates that the bank provided $141 million of debt financing for this project. Some sources identify this project as a 300MW project and others identify it as a 330MW project.
name: Habiganj

title: China Eximbank provides $325 million preferential buyer‚Äôs credit for Shahjalal Fertilizer Factory Project (Linked to Project ID #34230)
description:
On January 21, 2012, China Eximbank and the Government of Bangladesh signed an RMB 1.6 billion government concessional loan (GCL) and a $325 million preferential buyer‚Äôs credit (PBC) for the construction of the Shahjalal fertilizer factory near Fenchugonj Upazila (within the Sylhet District and the Division of Sylhett). Both the GCL and the PBC carried the following terms: 2% interest rate, 20-year maturity, a grace period of 5 years. Project ID#34230 captures the GCL, while this project captures the PBC. The Government of Bangladesh's loan identification number for the China Eximbank GCL is L1120120121a. The Government of Bangladesh's loan identification number for the China Eximbank PBC is B1120120121a. 

The purpose of this project was to set up a new urea fertilizer factory with a production capacity of 1760 metric tons per day (or 5,80,800 metric tons per year) of granular urea at the premises of Natural Gas Fertilizer Factory Limited (NGFFL) in Fenchugonj Upazila within Sylhet District and the Division of Sylhett. China National Complete Plant Import and Export Corporation Ltd was the EPC contractor for this project.  Its work was overseen by the state-owned Bangladesh Chemical Industries Corporation. China Chengda Engineering Company Ltd. was also involved in project implementation. 

A foundation stone laying ceremony took place on March 24, 2012. Construction began on or around the same date. The plant was handed over on February 29, 2016. Its originally expected completion date was June 15, 2015. The factory began commercial production on March 1, 2016.  

The Shahjalal Fertilizer Factory Project is located 6km south of the Fenchugonj Upazila (within the Sylhet District and the Division of Sylhett) and 4km to the south of Maijgaon Railway Station. More detailed locational information is available at https://www.google.com/maps/place/Shahjalal+Fertilizer+Company+Limited/@24.6518429,91.923766,14z/data=!4m8!1m2!2m1!1sNatural+Gas+Fertilizer+Factory+Limited!3m4!1s0x3751a4528bd36571:0x67b59ff2cb522d18!8m2!3d24.6517952!4d91.9412756.

STAFF_NOTE: In the document from the Shahjalal Fertilizer Company Limited (SFCL) website, the public assistance is listed as USD 560 million from China or 39,860,800,000 Taka. Therefore, the exchange rate used was 1 USD = 71.18 Taka. Using this exchange rate, the funding listed from the Government of Bangladesh in the document (8,883,672,000 Taka) would equal about USD 124.8 million.
name: Sylhet

title: China Eximbank provides RMB 1.6 billion government concessional loan for Shahjalal Fertilizer Factory Project (Linked to Project ID#38969)
description:
On January 21, 2012, China Eximbank and the Government of Bangladesh signed an RMB 1.6 billion government concessional loan (GCL) and a $325 million preferential buyer‚Äôs credit (PBC) for the construction of the Shahjalal fertilizer factory near Fenchugonj Upazila (within the Sylhet District and the Division of Sylhett).  Both the GCL and the PBC carried the following terms: 2% interest rate, 20-year maturity, a grace period of 5 years. This project captures the GCL, while Project ID #38969 captures the PBC. The Government of Bangladesh's loan identification number for the China Eximbank GCL is L1120120121a. 

The purpose of this project was to set up a new urea fertilizer factory with a production capacity of 1760 metric tons per day (or 5,80,800 metric tons per year) of granular urea at the premises of Natural Gas Fertilizer Factory Limited (NGFFL) in Fenchugonj Upazila within Sylhet District and the Division of Sylhett. China National Complete Plant Import and Export Corporation Ltd was the EPC contractor for this project.  Its work was overseen by the state-owned Bangladesh Chemical Industries Corporation. China Chengda Engineering Company Ltd. was also involved in project implementation. 

A foundation stone laying ceremony took place on March 24, 2012. Construction began on or around the same date. The plant was handed over on February 29, 2016. Its originally expected completion date was June 15, 2015. The factory began commercial production on March 1, 2016.  

More detailed locational information on the location of the project is available at https://www.google.com/maps/place/Shahjalal+Fertilizer+Company+Limited/@24.6518429,91.923766,14z/data=!4m8!1m2!2m1!1sNatural+Gas+Fertilizer+Factory+Limited!3m4!1s0x3751a4528bd36571:0x67b59ff2cb522d18!8m2!3d24.6517952!4d91.9412756.

STAFF_NOTE: The Government of Bangladesh loan identification number for the Eximbank GCL is L1120120121a. Therefore, the exchange rate used was 1 USD = 71.18 Taka. Using this exchange rate, the funding listed from Government of Bangladesh in the document (8,883,672,000 Taka) would equal about $124.8 million.
name: Sylhet

title: China grants $1 Million Aid to Nepal for Flood Response (linked to #53718)
description: On August 15, 2017, Chinese Vice-Premier Wang Yang agreed to provide $1 million humanitarian assistance aid to help repair regions affected by landslides and floods in Nepal. The agreement was signed during Wang's visit in Nepal, but it is unclear which branch of the Chinese government will provide the funding. More than 110 people were killed by landslides and flooding in Nepal. This project is now complete. In November 2017, China provided an additional grant of $4 million, described in project #53718
name: Nepal

title: $20 million grant for budgetary support
description: On January 14, 2012, China announced a one-time grant of US$20 million (over Rs 1.65 billion) to the government to support the peace process, in particular this grant is a budgetary support which will be used for financing rehabilitation of former Maoist combatants. This was announced when Prime Minister Wen Jiabao of China paid a short visit to Nepal (lasting four and a half hours), stopping over on his way to the Persian Gulf. According to the Nepal government, the agreement was signed in 2012 but not implemented yet as of 2018.
name: Nepal

title: China signed grant commitment for the Hospital Counterpart Support and the Maternal and Child Health Projects with Nepal
description: On January 18, 2017, Ambassador Yu Hong and Dr. Senendra Raj Upreti, Secretary of Ministry of Health of Nepal, signed grant commitments for two health projects. One for the hospital counterpart support and the other for the establishment of a maternal and child health pilot project. Both agreements were signed between the National Health and Family Planning Commission of the People's Republic of China and the Ministry of Health of the Government of Nepal. The agreement on the Cooperation to Carry out Targeted Hospital Counterpart Support will involve the 4th Hospital of Hebei Medical University in China helping the Nepali B. P. Koirala Cancer Hospital establish a pathology specialist field center. The agreement for the Cooperation to Carry out Maternal and Child Health Pilot Project is intended to help Nepal improve its medical standards in the field of maternal and child health care and cultivate maternal and child health professionals, and involve China donating relevant equipment and medicines to carry out maternal and child health monitoring, screening, and consultation activities.
name: Nepal

title: China donates security equipment to Nepal
description: In July 2010, China agreed to donate security equipment to the police services worth 26 million RMB (3,831,135 USD) to Nepal. It appears that the grant is intended primarily to strengthen monitoring of the Tibetan community in Nepal and security along the borders with China’s Tibet Autonomous Region. In June 2013, the equipment was disbursed to Nepal. The total commitment amount is $3,831,135, and the actual disbursement amount is $4,241,228 (Updated January 2019).
name: Nepal

title: China sends 2nd Chinese Government Medical Team after Nepal earthquake
description: After the earthquake that occurred in April 2015 in Nepal, the Health and Family Planning Commission of Chongqing organized a second Chinese Government medical team [中国政府医疗队] consisting of 56 people. The team arrived in Nepal on May 8th, and took over the work from the first Chinese Government medical team. The team returned to Chongqing on May 24th.
name: Nepal

title: China provides government scholarship to Nepal students
description: On August 26, 2017, the Chinese Embassy in Nepal held a Chinese Government Scholarship Award Ceremony in Kathmandu. Ambassador Hou Yanqi attended and delivered a speech. Dahar, Permanent Secretary of the Ministry of Education and Science and Technology of Nepal, was invited to attend the event. Over 100 Nepali students were granted university-level scholarships for their higher education in China for the 2017-2018 academic year.
name: Nepal

title: China Provides Language Training to Nepalese Tourism Professionals (linked #53705)
description: On March 23, 2016, China agreed to provide Chinese language training for 200 Nepalese tourism professionals within 5 years. The project aimed at boosting Nepal's tourism industry because based on data in 2017, China was the largest tourism source market for Nepal. The Chinese Language Training Course for Nepali Tourism Professionals was organized by the Chinese Embassy and Ministry of Culture, Tourism and Civil Aviation of Nepal. The project started in July, 2017, and as of November, 2018, the third course had been held. The project is in progress. STAFF_NOTE: This project is linked to a human resources training agreement (#53705) signed at the same time.
name: Nepal

title: China Funds Solar Energy Training Course for African Countries
description: June 2016, China organized a solar energy training course for countries in tropical and subtropical regions. Twenty individuals from eight countries and regions, including Ghana, Rwanda, Nepal, and Kenya were enrolled in the course in Lanzhou, capital of Northwest China's Gansu province. The training is sponsored by China's Ministry of Commerce and implemented by Gansu Natural Energy Research Institute, and it will focus on the technology of solar photovoltaic (PV) systems, solar water heaters, solar building, and solar desalination. The 28-day course will include lectures, technical exchanges, economic and trade talks, and on-site practice. China hopes to help these countries make better use of the energy with its advanced renewable energy technology. The cost of the project is unknown.
name: Nepal

title: China donates books to school to Nepal
description:
On March 1, 2012, Chinese Ambassador Yang Houlan donated a batch of introductory books on China on behalf of the Chinese government to a primary and secondary school in the northern mountains. 

STAFF_NOTE: The exact english translation of the school's name is unknown, in one Chinese Embassy source it is reported as "加林山卡中小学" and in the other as "卡利纳格中小学".
name: Nepal

title: China Eximbank provides RMB 218.8 million loan through ETCA for acquisition of 4 aircrafts (linked to Project ID #34442)
description:
In 2013, Nepal signed an Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreement (ETCA) with China to procure and purchase six China-made airplanes. According to the deal, Nepal will acquire two aircrafts — a 19-seater Harbin Y-12E and a 58-seater Modern Ark 60 (MA60) — with a RMB 180 million Chinese Government grant (project #34442) and acquire three Harbin Y12E and a MA60 with a RMB 218.8 million government concessional loan (Project ID#34441) from China Eximbank. The terms of the China Eximbank government concessional loan (GCL) were as follows: 1.5% interest rate, 20 year maturity, and 7 year grace period. The Government of Nepal used the proceeds of the China Eximbank loan to on-lend to Nepal Airlines Corporation (NAC) through a subsidiary loan agreement (SLA). NAC aims to deploy the MA60 aircraft for mountain flights and other reachable places such as Pokhara, Bhairahawa, Biratnagar, Dhangadhi, Nepalgunj and Simara. It also announced that it may operate the Harbin Y-12e for mountain flights and other destinations in far-flung areas. 

On April 28, 2014, the delivery ceremony of the Chinese MA60 aircraft was held in Kathmandu. Chairman of AVIC International [中国航空技术国际控股有限公司] Wu Guangquan [吴光权] and Nepal Airlines General Manager Karel [卡雷尔] signed the MA60 aircraft technical transfer documents [新舟60飞机技术移交文件].  In November 2014, Harbin Aircraft Manufacturing Corporation (now called the Harbin Aircraft Industry Group Co. Ltd.) officially handed over the first of the Y12-Es, 9N-AKS, to NAC at a ceremony held in Kathmandu. According to a 2018 report from the Government of Nepal’s Auditor General, these aircrafts were operating domestic flights, but the NAC was incurring financial losses from the operation of the aircrafts. In 2019, the International Relations Committee of the Federal House of Representatives issued a directive to the Government of Nepal to sell the loss-making aircrafts.
name: Nepal

title: Red Cross Society of China donates 5 million RMB to Nepal following the 2015 earthquake
description: Shortly after the 25 April 2015 earthquake in Nepal, the Red Cross Society of China donated 5 million RMB to Nepal for emergency earthquake relief efforts. According to the United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) Financial Tracking Service (flow ID #127980), the donation included 2,000 tents.
name: Nepal

title: China contributes 100,000 USD to comprehensive disaster risk management program in Nepal
description: China contributed 100,000 USD to Nepal's Comprehensive Disaster Risk Management Program (CDRMP). Other donors included the Department for International Development, the European Union, Japan, Korea, the International Cooperation Agency, the United Nations Development Programme, the United Nations International Strategy for Disaster Reduction, and the World Bank.
name: Nepal

title: China donates 250,000 RMB worth of books to 14 schools in Nepal
description: In September 2011, Chinese Ambassador to Nepal Yang Houlan attended the Chinese Books Donation Ceremony and on behalf of the Chinese Language Council International (Hanban) he donated Chinese books worth 250,000 Chinese yuan to fourteen schools in Nepal. The donation consisted of teaching materials, teaching guidance, Chinese readings, picture albums, audiovisual products, maps, and e-audible teaching aids.
name: Nepal

title: China donates 3 million yuan in food aid to Nepal (Linked to Project ID #34410 and #34426)
description: In April 2009, China announced a 3 million yuan grant to Nepal for food assistance. The aid will be disbursed over five years, which consists of sugar, salt and other basic necessities for the northern region of Nepal. Chairman to Tibet Autonomous Region Champa Phuntshok announced the aid package during Nepalese Foreign Minister Upendra Yadav's visit to China. STAFF_NOTE: Projects #34410 and #34426 are most likely donations from this pledge.
name: Nepal

title: China provides RMB 180 million grant for acquisition of Harbin Y-12E and MA60 aircrafts (Linked to Project ID#34441)
description:
On November 28, 2013, Nepal signed an economic and technical cooperation agreement with China to procure and purchase six China-made airplanes. According to the deal, Nepal agreed acquire two aircrafts — a 19-seater Harbin Y-12E and a 58-seater Modern Ark 60 (MA60) — with a RMB 180 million Chinese Government grant (project #34442) and acquire three Harbin Y12E and a MA60 with a RMB 218.8 million concessional loan (project #34441) from China Eximbank.  The grant for the acquisition of the Harbin Y-12E and the MA60 is worth RMB 180 million (about Rs 2.98 billion). The Government of Nepal’s Aid Management Information System (AMIS) records the USD value of the grant as $27,900,000. 

On April 28, 2014, the delivery ceremony of the Chinese MA60 aircraft was held in Kathmandu. Chairman of AVIC International [中国航空技术国际控股有限公司] Wu Guangquan [吴光权] and Nepal Airlines General Manager Karel [卡雷尔] signed the MA60 aircraft technical transfer documents [新舟60飞机技术移交文件]. Then, in November 2014, Harbin Aircraft Manufacturing Corporation (now called the Harbin Aircraft Industry Group Co. Ltd.) officially handed over the first of the Y12-Es, 9N-AKS, to NAC at a ceremony held in Kathmandu. According to a 2018 report from the Government of Nepal’s Auditor General, these aircrafts were operating domestic flights, but the NAC was incurring financial losses from the operation of the aircrafts. In 2019, the International Relations Committee of the Federal House of Representatives issued a directive to the Government of Nepal to sell the loss-making aircrafts.
name: Nepal

title: China trains 400 Nepali in human resource development
description: In March 2016, China announced it would provide the opportunity for 400 Nepali to be trained in human resource development, as well as offer more government scholarships to Nepalese as part of an effort to enhance contact between their peoples. The agreement was made during an official visit of the Prime Minister of Nepal to China from March 20 to 27, 2016. staff_note: on pg 121
name: Nepal

title: China donates 3,220,883 USD of emergency medical and epidemic prevention supplies to Nepal
description: According to Nepal's Aid Management Platform, in 2015, China donated 3,220,883 USD of emergency medical supplies and epidemic supplies to Nepal.
name: Nepal

title: China provides $4 million for Nepal Livelihood Recovery for Peace
description: On November 17, 2017, China provided Nepal with a cash donation of $4 million to support Livelihood Recovery for Peace (LRP) project, which originally started in 2009. However, only $3,810,139 has been disbursed so far. The Nepal Livelihood Recovery Project constructs peace buildings at the community level and brings marked improvements in the livelihoods of vulnerable, excluded, and economically deprived households and communities. According to its descriptions, it provides support to women empowerment and allows most deprived individuals to have more assets. This is also a part of earthquake assistance initiative. An undated article published by the UNDP has reported that the LRP project has made an impact in the affected communities.
name: Nepal

title: Chinese Government provides RMB 470,000 grant for Oil and Gas Resources Survey Project
description: On March 21, 2016, China signed Exchange of Letters to provide the grant assistance of RMB 470,000 for the oil and gas exploration project of Nepal. The agreement was under the commercial deal on the supply of petroleum products between the two countries. China also agreed to build oil storage facilities and send exports to carry out the research on oil exploration for Nepal. On February 22, 2018, Nepal's Department of Mines and Geology informed that a Chinese expert team from China National Petroleum Corporation will visit Nepal to conduct the feasibility study, but the actual date was not determined. It is not clear whether the grants assistance has been disbursed. STAFF_NOTE: Limited information on the status of the grant assistance.
name: Nepal

title: Chinese company CAMC conducts feasibility study for Kathmandu-Pokhara Railway for Nepal
description: On December 18, 2015, Chinese CAMC Engineering Company pledged to conduct the feasibility study of the Kathmandu-Pokhara Railway for Nepal. The company is a subsidiary of the state-owned China National Machinery Industry Corporation (SINOMACH), and will bear all the costs including financial and technical investment for the study. By June, 2016, the China CAMC Engineering Company Ltd has submitted a feasibility report on Kathmandu-Pokhara electric railway, planning to develop 164.395-kilometre railway, which will have 27 tunnels and 53 bridges. This segment will have 12 stations between Kathmandu and Pokhara, according to the media report. 151 hectares of forest has been acquired for the construction of the railway, and the project has an estimated cost of USD2830 Million(Rs257 billion), and takes approximately nine years to complete. The Kathmandu-Pokhara Railway was a segment of the trans-Himalayan Railway Project planned by China and Nepal to connect the two countries. The Kathmandu-Pokhara section will act as an extension of the Gyirong-Kathmandu Railway, allowing for easy access from China to Pokhara, a top tourist destination in Nepal.
name: Nepal

title: China donates $10M in earthquake aid to Nepal
description: In 2015, China announced it would donate $10 million in earthquake relief to Nepal. However, as of March 2016, only $5,093,531 had been given.
name: Nepal

title: China signs agreement on infrastructure grant with Nepal
description: On May 14, 2001 China and Nepal signed six agreements, including one for an infrastructure grant.
name: Nepal

title: PetroChina Granted 1.2 Million Liters Petroleum to Nepal (linked to #53157)
description: On October 28, 2015, China National United Oil Corporation signed a memorandum of understanding with Nepal Oil Corporation (NOC) to grant 1.2 million liters of petroleum to Nepal. On October 31, 2015, China handed over the oil. The grant aimed at helping relieve the acute energy shortage in Nepal. 'We have received 73.5 metric tons of petrol from China in these two days,' NOC spokesperson Deepak Baral told Xinhua. In December of the same year, China provided an additional 1.4 million liters (captured in project (#53157)
name: Nepal

title: China donates 6000 books to schools in Nepal
description: In August 2009, Chinese Language Council International (Hanban) donated more than 6,000 books about Chinese language and culture to several primary and secondary schools to help Nepali students learn more about China and become interested in promoting the friendship between Nepal and China.
name: Nepal

title: Chinese Government provides RMB 10 million grant for the provision of supplies to support Nepal's General Elections
description: In 2013, the Chinese Government and the Government of Nepal signed letters of exchange on the provision of logistical materials and office supplies to support the Constituent Assembly Election. The value of the donated materials was RMB 10 million (approximately NRS 154.1 million). On September 27, 2013, a plane with the election materials arrived in Kathmandu, including ballot papers and office materials. China's Ambassador to Nepal, Wu Chuntai, and Joint Secretary of Nepal's Election Commission, Maheshow Neupane, were present at the airport to receive the donation. These materials were be used for the conduction of the Nepal's 27th general elections on November 19, 2013.
name: Nepal

title: China donates emergency food aid to Nepal after earthquake
description: In 2015, the Tibet Frontier Corps at Nyalam Checkpoints donated 2kg of rice, 3200kg of salt and 200 boxes of instant noodles to Nepal. These items are to be distributed by the Nepali armed force and police force to areas severely affected by the April 2015 7.3 magnitude earthquake.
name: Nepal

title: China donates wushu kits worth Rs 5 million to Nepal
description: In April 2010, China donated wushu kits worth 5 million Nepalese Rupees to the Nepal Wushu Association at the 11th South Asian Games. Chinese Ambassador to Nepal Qiu Guohong handed over the kits to Nepali Youth and Sports Minister Ganesh Nepali.
name: Nepal

title: China signs agreement on infrastructure grants with Nepal
description: In February 2000, China and Nepal signed an agreement for China to provide grants for infrastructure projects in Nepal.
name: Nepal

title: China donates 1.3 million USD worth of logistic materials for the constituent assembly election in Nepal
description: In July 2007, Chinese Assistant Minister of Commerce Wang Chao and Nepali Prime Minister Girija Prasad Koirala signed letters of exchange on China's logistic materials aid worth 1.3 million USD for the November 2007 constituent assembly elections. In November 2007, China handed over the logistic materials for the elections and both parties signed and exchanged the delivery and receipt certificates.
name: Nepal

title: 200 million yuan grant for economic and technical assistance as part of a 750 million grant (linked to project #34429)
description: In 2012, China signed an agreement to provide an annual grant assistance of 200 million RMB to Nepal as part of a 750 million RMB three years grant assistance under their Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreement. According to the export of AMP report in December 2018, the actual amount committed is 31,480,199 USD. The project is part of a larger cooperation grant agreement, linked to project #34429.
name: Nepal

title: China makes first donation to Nepal worth 20 million RMB for earthquake relief (Linked to project #38415, #38417)
description: On 25 April 2015, a massive earthquake hit Nepal. On 27 April, the Chinese Embassy in Nepal posted a press release announcing that the Chinese government had decided to donate disaster relief materials worth 20 million RMB to Nepal. This donation-- including 1,600 tents, 10,000 blankets, 327 generators, and other urgently needed supplies-- were shipped on a planes on 28 and 29 April 2015. The United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) Financial Tracking Service flow ID #127958 captures the aggregate amount of round two and three for a total of 60 million RMB. The Chinese government donated two more rounds of disaster relief packages. The second round worth 40 million RMB is captured in project #38415, and the third worth 80 million RMB is described in project #38417.
name: Nepal

title: China provides two mobile hospital units worth Rs 917 million to Nepal Army (linked to #34439)
description: In July 2013, the Chinese People's Liberation Army (PLA) pledged to provide the Nepali Army (NA) with two mobile hospital units worth Rs 917 million during the visit of Chief of Army Staff (CoAS), Gaurav Sumsher Rana, to China. Mobile hospital units are used in times of disaster and accidents to provide medical assistance to victims on location, as they are easy to transport and set up. The two hospitals, which were to include beds with emergency department, critical care holding area, fully digital X-ray unit, a small lab, a blood bank and operating rooms, could accommodate between 26 and 50 patients at a time. The mobile hospital units would also contain surgical processing units with autoclave, surgical equipment disposal unit, a central medical supply with stores and an administrative with command control unit. This agreement was reached between Nepal Army chief Gaurav SJB Rana and his Chinese counterpart Fang Fenghui, during the former's visit to China's People's Liberation Army (PLA) general staff headquarters in Beijing. The two mobile hospital units were successfully delivered on April 27, 2015. This project is linked to project #34439, in which the Chinese Government committed Rs 778 million for military assistance during the same visit.
GEO_sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=ANNT000020130829e97n000on&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=ATHIMT0020131215e9cf00036&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=HTREPB0020130722e97m000p4&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks
name: Nepal

title: China grants $4 million in aid for flood damages to Nepal (linked to project #54190)
description: In November 2017, China agreed to donate $4 million to UNDP for aid to the victims of heavy rainstorms in Nepal. The aid includes blankets, cooking utensils, mosquito nets, water filters and hygiene kits, which will benefit 31,800 affected families in 7 provinces. The implementation of programs start on January 11, 2018, and all delivery completed on March 26, 2018. This project is linked to the August 2017 $1 million given by China to Nepal in response to flooding (see project #54190).
name: Nepal

title: Chinese Government provides RMB 1 billion grant through ETCA for Upgrading of the Kodari Highway and Rasuwa Bridge Construction Project
description: On August 16, 2017, Nepal and China have signed an Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreement (ETCA) to provide 1 billion RMB and technical cooperation for the reconstruction of Kodari Highway and construction of a bridge in Rasuwa. This project also includes the establishment of hydropower projects and transmission lines for connectivity.
name: Nepal

title: China provides 1,771,486 USD in emergency oil products to Nepal
description: In August 2016, China provided 1,771,486 USD in emergency petroleum to Nepal.
name: Nepal

title: China donates 9 Million RMB Donation to Support Local Elections of Nepal
description: On March 27, 2017, during Chinese President Xi Jinping's meeting with the Prime Minister of Nepal, Pushpa Kamal Dahal, Xi Jinping pledged 9 Million RMB to assist local level elections that Nepal would be holding on May 14. According to the Prime Minister, the Chinese President had expressed concern for political stability of Nepal, and was happy to see the local elections being held. The aid materials include 11 gel pens, calculators, punchers, staplers, etc., worth 9 million yuan, and arrived in Kathmandu in two batches. On April 17, 2017, the handover certificate was signed.
GEO_sources: http://kathmandupost.ekantipur.com/news/2017-03-28/china-pledges-rs-136m-assistance-for-local-polls.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://archive.nepalitimes.com/blogs/thebrief/2017/03/27/dahal-xi-meet/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://m.xinhuanet.com/2017-04/17/c_129544082.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://np.china-embassy.org/chn/xwdt/t1454830.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
name: Nepal

title: Chinese Government provies grant for Earthquake Monitoring Network Project
description: On July 23, 2015, Chinese Government and Nepal Government signed a Memorandum of Understanding on the Planning of Post-earthquake Reconstruction Assistance Projects. Earthquake Monitoring Network Project(中国援尼泊尔地震监测台网建设) is one of the assisting post-disaster reconstruction projects launched by the Chinese reconstruction after Nepal Earthquake. The project was undertaken by the Institute of Geophysics, China Earthquake Administration, the Development Research Center of China Earthquake Administration, and the Nepal Department of Mines and Geology. Through this project, a national seismic data center was established in Kathmandu, 2 data backup centers were built in Biratnagar, and 10 seismic observatories were equipped in the northern part of Nepal to monitor and warn earthquakes of magnitude 3 and above in Nepal.
GEO_sources: https://web.archive.org/web/20190818231829/http://www.mof.gov.np/uploads/document/file/20140820115245.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.fmprc.gov.cn/ce/cenp/eng/EconomyTrade/chinaaid/t1770299.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.dropbox.com/s/p3yzsp6oc5kyngc/%E7%A0%94%E7%A9%B6%E6%89%80%E5%8A%A8%E6%80%81-%E4%B8%AD%E5%9B%BD%E5%9C%B0%E9%9C%87%E5%B1%80%E5%9C%B0%E7%90%83%E7%89%A9%E7%90%86%E7%A0%94%E7%A9%B6%E6%89%80.pdf?dl=0, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://www.cea-igp.ac.cn/cxdt/277073.html, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; https://www.cea.gov.cn/cea/xwzx/xydt/5526985/index.html, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; https://www.spotlightnepal.com/2019/10/13/list-instruments-singed-and-exchanged-between-nepal-and-china/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.dropbox.com/s/zoaphuzh57yrd8c/dp_profile_20190331055603.pdf?dl=0, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.dropbox.com/s/zoaphuzh57yrd8c/dp_profile_20190331055603.pdf?dl=0, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
name: Nepal

title: Red Cross Society of China donates 500,000 HKD to Nepal following the 2015 earthquake
description: Shortly after the 25 April 2015 earthquake in Nepal, the Red Cross Society of China (probably through the Hong Kong branch) donated 500,000 HKD to Nepal for emergency earthquake relief efforts. How exactly this money was spent is unknown.
name: Nepal

title: China Grant 1.4 Million Liters of Fuel to Nepal (linked to #53155)
description: On December 29, 2015, the Chinese government signed an agreement to grant an additional 1.4 million liters of petroleum worth 10 million Yuan to Nepal. The grant aimed at helping the country cope with the fuel shortages after the devastating earthquake on April 25, 2015. Deputy Prime Minister of Nepal Kamal Thapa secured the grant during his visit in Beijing. Nepal Oil Corporation transported the fuel provided by China from Kerung in Tibet to Kathmandu. This is an additional grant, following a previous donation of 1.2 million liters in October (project 53155). STAFF_NOTE: Nepal Oil Corporation was recorded as the participating organization because its officials reported the figure of this project.
name: Nepal

title: China donates 750,000 NPR to to Nepal Red Cross following the August 2006 Floods
description: In late August 2006 after unusually heavy monsoon rains, Nepal experienced the worse floods and landslides in 40 years. On 4 September 2006, the Chinese government responded with a 750,000 NPR (about $10,000 USD) to the Red Cross Society of Nepal for disaster relief. The United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) Financial Tracking Service captures this project in flow ID #40916.
name: Nepal

title: China donates 3 million Rs worth of books to schools in Nepal
description: In July 2010, the Chinese Language Council International (Hanban) donated more than 3 million Rs worth of books about Chinese language and culture to several primary and secondary schools in Nepal to help Nepali students learn more about China and become interested in promoting the friendship between Nepal and China.
name: Nepal

title: CDB provides $462 million loan to finance the capital expenditures of the 2G, 3G and BWA services of Aircel and its 3 Indian subsidiaries
description: On March 19th, 2015, China Development Bank loaned $462 million USD to finance the capital expenditures of the 2G, 3G and BWA services of Aircel and its three subsidiaries in India. The loan has a duration of 10 years and is a part of a $651 million USD syndicated loan from SEK and the Nordic Investment Bank. STAFF_NOTE: Couldn't find additional sources that specifically cited the CDB loan of $462 million. In 2018, Aircel went bankrupt. Multiple creditors are bringing Aircel to court in order to recover funds, including the CDB.
name: India

title: China Pledges to Train 100 Indian Officials on Heavy Haul Transportation (linked to Project ID #42673)
description: In September 2014, during the visit of Chinese President, Xi Jinping, to India, China agreed to train 100 officials of Indian Railway on heavy haul transportation. This project is linked to project #42673, the redevelopment of the Chennai-Bengaluru-Mysore railway, which was committed to during the same September 2014 visit. On December 26, 2014, the first batch, twenty-two of the 100 officials, began their 12-day training at Jiaotong University. The inauguration ceremony for training in the heavy-haul technology for the 22 officers from the Indian Railway was held at Beijing Jiaotong University yesterday, an Indian Embassy press release issued here today said. The 12-day training programme, which is being conducted by Beijing Jiaotong University under the supervision of National Railway Administration of China, is the first step in the cooperation envisaged by India and China in the MoU and Implementation Plan on Cooperation in Railways. The training emphasized onsite training covering operational and maintenance facilities, monitoring systems, and traffic controls. Four more batches from Indian railway officials will be trained at the Beijing Jiatong University in heavy-haul technology in the next two years, the press release said.
name: India

title: ICBC provides $80 million loan to IL&FS for infrastructure projects and creation of subsidiary company in transportation sector
description: On September 13th, 2016, the Industrial & Commercial Bank of China loaned $80 million USD to Infrastructure Leasing & Financial Services Group (IL&FS) for infrastructure projects and the creation of a subsidiary company in the transportation sector: IL&FS Transportation Networks Limited (ITNL). Terms of the loan are unclear. STAFF_NOTE: 5 MARCH 2019 Phone numbers and email addresses for contacts listed on page 3 of IL&FS source.
name: India

title: China and India establish Sino-India Communication Fund
description:
In 2006, China and India agree to start Sino-India Communication Funds (中印交流基金). The fund is established to enhance academic communication between both countries. The details of the fund will be decided in later communication.  It is unclear how China is funding this project and what financial value they have contributed.  It is unclear which organizations from China or India are involved in this project.

Quotes: 30、为进一步促进中印学术交流，双方同意推动建立 “中印交流基金”。基金的具体模式将通过双方磋商制定。
name: India

title: Chinese Embassy Donates Education Materials to Indian Universities
description: In 2014, to help Indian students learn Chinese, the Chinese Embassy in India has come forward to donate computers and other resource materials to universities that offer Chinese language courses. The announcement was made by the Chinese Ambassador to India, Wei Wei, at a function at VIT under the aegis of the Chinese Language Center (CLC). This function was held to reward the winners of the first ever Chinese Bridge 2014 (Chinese Language Proficiency competitions for Indian students learning Chinese language) conducted in India.
name: India

title: China extends loan of $98m to ICICI Bank of India
description: On March 19, 2009, the Export Import Bank of China (China Exim bank) and ICICI Bank signed a loan agreement for $98 million USD under a two-step buyer credit (export credit) arrangement. The ICICI Bank signed the loan agreement through its Hong Kong branch and is the first Indian bank to have entered into this arrangement with China Exim. The cooperation between ICICI Bank and China Exim bank is likely to lead to creation of business opportunities for Chinese firms in India and is also expected to help Indian companies in tying-up long-term debt for their projects.
name: India

title: Red Cross Society of Hong Kong grants 132,376 HKD to IFRC following the 2004 floods in India
description: Following severe flooding in India, on 30 July 2004, the Red Cross Society of Hong Kong through the Red Cross Society of China pledged 132,376 HKD (or 21,418 CHf) in cash to the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies (IFRC) for the procurement of food items in India. This donation would feed an estimated 1,500 families for 1.5 months (see: Aug. '04 IFRC report). A December 2004 report from IFRC says the entire pledge was received. The United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) Financial Tracking Service captures this donation in flow ID #22840.
name: India

title: CDB and Sistema Shyam sign $255 million loan facility for the purchase of telecommunication equipment(Linked to Project ID #67447)
description: On December 23, 2009, On 23 December 2009, Sistema Shyam TeleServices Limited (SSTL) entered into a facility agreement with the China Development Bank Corporation allowing borrowings of up to approximately $255 million. The loan was provided to finance telecommunication equipment supplies. The facility has a maturity of 2017 (8-year maturity period) with a grace period of 3 years. The interest rate is LIBOR +1.5% (2.31%). As of December 31, 2011, the total outstanding amount of the facility was $250.36 million. It has been assumed that the entire amount was drawn down and that SSTL repaid around $4 million of the facility. The facility is guaranteed by Sistema JSFC. Non-compliance with the covenants of the facility agreement with the China Development Bank Corporation, in addition to other events, may constitute an event of default. These other events include: (i) any creditor becoming entitled to declare the debt of SSTL (and its subsidiaries) or Sistema JSFC over a certain amount due and payable as a result of an event of default provided that such default has continued for a specified period of time; (ii) the termination, suspension or cancellation of any authorization or licence of SSTL to provide wireless telephony services, or the modification or renewal of any such licence, in each case which would have a material adverse effect on the business, operations, assets or financial condition of SSTL or Sistema JSFC; (iii) the commencement or threat of any litigation, arbitration or administrative proceeding of or before any court, arbitral body or agency against SSTL, any of its subsidiaries or Sistema JSFC, which, if adversely determined, might reasonably be expected to have a material adverse effect on the business, operations, assets or financial condition of SSTL or Sistema JSFC; (iv) any event or circumstance which has a material adverse effect on the business, financial condition, results of operations or prospectus of SSTL or Sistema JSFC; (v) any legal proceeding initiated with a view to the seizure, compulsory acquisition, expropriation or nationalisation of all or a material part of the undertakings, assets, rights, revenues or shares of SSTL; (vi) any breach of representation (which automatically repeat on each draw-down request date and on each interest payment date), including (without limitation) a representation that no litigation has been commenced which, if adversely determined, might reasonably be expected to have a material adverse effect on the business, financial condition, results of operations or prospectus of SSTL or Sistema JSFC; and (vii) any expropriation, attachment, sequestration, distress or execution that affects any asset or assets of SSTL or any of its subsidiaries or Sistema JSFC. SSTL is an Indian mobile and fixed communication operator with a spectrum in 22 licence circles covering a total population of approximately 1.2 billion people located in all of the 28 administrative states and seven union territories. STAFF_NOTE: The interest rate has been recorded as listed on pages 147 and F-39 of the '2012 Bond Prospectus for Bashnet'. Related to Project #67447 which turns out to be a project in India(see '2012 Bond prospectus for Bashnet'). On 14 January 2016, Reliance Communications announced that it had acquired Sistema Shyam TeleServices Limited (SSTL, operating as MTS India) in an all-stock deal. In February 2019, Reliance Communications filed for bankruptcy as it was unable to sell assets to repay its debts.
name: India

title: India CBSE signs MoU with Hanban for Teaching Chinese in India
description:
In August 2008, Hanban and India Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) signed a Memorandum of Understanding on teaching Chinese in India. Xu Lin (许琳), the director of Hanban and chief officer of Confucius Institute, and Subrahmanyam Jaishanker (苏杰生), India Ambassador of India signed the paperwork in Embassy of India in China. 

Hanban agreed to support India in training 300 Chinese teachers, offer 100 annual scholarships for Indian teachers teaching Chinese to train in China, and provide assistance to establish the teaching of Chinese.

In addition, CBSE decided to include Chinese in foreign language courses. It will start by establishing Chinese courses in 500 middle schools and expand to total 11,500 middle schools in the future.
name: India

title: China and India plans to complete Sino-India Culture Communication Encyclopedia in 2014
description:
On May 20, 2013, China and India announced in the joint statement that they plan to complete Sino-India Culture Communication Encyclopedia in 2014. The encyclopedia is designed to increase news media communication and cooperation, as well as enhance citizens to know and develop friendships between both countries. India agreed to launch classics translation project. The Encyclopedia was released in both English and Chinese versions by the Vice Presidents of India and China on June 30, 2014, in Beijing. It features over 700 entries, covering contacts and exchanges between the two countries in the trade, economic, literary, cultural and philosophical spheres. The Indian Ministry of External Affairs and financial value of this project is unclear.
Plans to complete Sino-India Culture Communication Encyclopedia were announced at the same time as the Sino-India classics translation project (#54024).

Quote: 加强两国新闻媒体交流与合作，增进两国人民相互了解和友好感情,双方决定于2014年完成《中印文化交流百科全书》编撰工作，同意启动中印经典作品互译工程。
name: India

title: Red Cross Society of Hong Kong donates $41,124 USD to IFRC in India
description: According to the UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Response (OCHA) Financial Tracking Service (flow ID #15465), on 12 June 2003, the Hong Kong Red Cross through the Red Cross Society of China granted $41,124 USD to the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies (IFRC) for 'renovation' in India under the early recovery sector. All other project details are unknown.
name: India

title: China and India Institutionalize Annual Sino-India Media Summit
description: In 2015, China and India agree to institutionalize annual Sino-India Media Summit. The summit is designed to enhance communication and mutual understanding. It will be responsible by China State Council Information Office and India Ministry of Foreign Affair. The summit will be held annually and in each country in turn. The first summit was established and agreed on in 2013 when the previous China-India Joint Statement was established. Other related project captured in the same article includes the establishment of an annual Sino-India Think Tank conference (#54020). STAFF_NOTE: It is unclear if there is a financial flow from China to India.
name: India

title: China and India Initiate Annual Sino-India Think Tank Conference
description:
In May 2015, China and India agree to start annual Sino-India Think Tank Conference. It will be held in each country in turn. The conference is established to enhance communication and increase mutual understanding. The India-China Think Tank Forum was established by Prime Minister Narendra Modi and President Xi Jinping during the Indian Prime Minister’s visit to China. The goal of this conference is to foster closer dialogue and mutual understanding between the two countries and to deliberate on contemporary issues of regional and international significance. The 2015 conference had two roundtable discussions: one on Indo-Chinese cooperation on global economic governance and another on how India and China could steer global financial markets. 

The Chinese delegation was led by Prof. Wang Weiguang, President of the Chinese Academy of Social Sciences (CASS).  It is the first and the most comprehensive academic research organization in China for study in the fields of philosophy and social sciences and is central to policy-making in China. The transaction amount is unknown. 

Other project captures at the same source include institutionalizing Sino-India Media Summit (Code: 54021) and establishing Mahatma Gandhi (圣雄甘地) India Research Center in Fudan University.

STAFF_NOTE: The flow class and flow type were marked as vague because it is unclear if China will provide any financial flow to India.  The Chinese Academy of Social Sciences is affiliated with the State Council of China, so this project is listed as official finance.
name: India

title: Bank of China provides $69.9 million loan to SSTL to buy ZTE equipment (Linked to Project ID #67448)
description: On June 29, 2009, Sistema Shyam TeleServices Limited (SSTL), a joint venture between Sistema of Russia and Shyam Group of India, entered into a buyer credit agreement (SSTL-Bank of China Agreement) with Bank of China Limited, Shenzhen Branch allowing borrowings of up to approximately $69.9 million (under security of China Export & Credit Insurance Corporation Sinosure), to facilitate investments for augmenting the nation-wide wireless infrastructure of its mobile services network in India, under the MTS brand. The loan was provided to finance telecommunication equipment supplies. As of December 31, 2011, the total amount outstanding under the credit agreement was approximately $69.6 million. The loan has a final maturity date of October 6, 2017. The agreement is for a period of eight years with three years of moratorium on principle repayment. The facilities have interest rates between 2.31-2.76% (LIBOR+ 2.31%-2.76). The company will invest the loan to source supplies from ZTE, a provider of telecommunications equipment and network services to build-out the CDMA network. The facility is guaranteed by Sistema JSFC. The loan is subject to a number of early repayment events, including change of control over the borrower. Non-compliance with covenants under the credit agreement with Bank of China Limited, Shenzhen Branch, in addition to other events, may constitute an event of default. These other events include: (i) any creditor becoming entitled to declare the debt of SSTL (and its subsidiaries) or Sistema JSFC over a certain amount due and payable as a result of an event of default; (ii) any litigation, arbitration, administrative, governmental, regulatory or other investigation, proceedings or disputes which could reasonably be expected to have a material adverse effect on the business, assets, financial condition, results of operations or prospects of SSTL or Sistema JSFC; (iii) any event or circumstance or environmental incident which are in the opinion of the lender reasonably likely to have, or result in, a material adverse effect on SSTL or Sistema; (iv) termination, expiration, renewal of an Indian telecom licence, or any circumstance subsisting which permits termination of an Indian telecom licence, which the lenders determine has or is likely to have a material adverse effect on the business, assets, financial condition, results of operations or prospects of SSTL or Sistema JSFC; (v) any expropriation, attachment, sequestration, distress or execution affecting any asset or assets of SSTL (or any of its subsidiaries), or Sistema JSFC (or any of its material subsidiaries as listed in the agreement) with a value above a certain amount; (vi) any breach of representation (which automatically repeat on each draw-down request date and on the first day of each interest period), including (without limitation) a representation that no litigation has been commenced which, if adversely determined, might reasonably be expected to have a material adverse effect on the business, assets, financial condition, results of operations or prospects of SSTL or Sistema JSFC; and (vii) any steps taken (or statement of intention to take steps) by any governmental authority with a view to the seizure, expropriation, nationalisation or acquisition of controlling stake in SSTL or assets or revenues of SSTL with a value above a certain amount. STAFF_NOTE: The loan will go to projects in India not Russia. On 14 January 2016, Reliance Communications announced that it had acquired Sistema Shyam TeleServices Limited (SSTL, operating as MTS India) in an all-stock deal. In February 2019, Reliance Communications filed for bankruptcy as it was unable to sell assets to repay its debts.
name: India

title: Chinese doctors to provide free services in India
description: In January 2008, it was announced that a joint team of Chinese and Indian doctors will provide free medical services in some of the poorest regions of India in memory of an Indian doctor who died serving in China over 70 years ago. A China India Joint Medical Mission (CIJMM) has been set up during Prime Minister Manmohan Singh's visit to Beijing to serve the rural populations of the two countries. The 20 doctors will first serve in Hebei province in north China. The joint mission is also expected to visit India by the end of the year. All the medical services offered by the doctors would be free. These would include medical consultations and drugs.
name: India

title: China and India Send 200 Youth to Visit Each Other As Cultural Communication (Linked to Project #54025)
description: In July 2015, China and India agree to send 200 youth to each other's country. The delegation comprising students, researchers, youth leaders visited various Chinese cities including Beijing, Wuhan, Kunming, Shanghai, and Guangzhou from July 3 to 10, 2015. India and China have implemented the annual India-China Youth Exchange program since 2006-2007. A large delegation of Chinese youth have also been visiting India under this program. In his speech, Indian Ambassador Gautam Bambawale emphasized strengthening people-to-people exchanges between the two countries. The other project achieved at the same time is the Sino-India Communication Fund(#54025) STAFF_NOTE: CRS Sector 16061 (culture and recreation). The flow type and flow class were set to vague, as it is unclear how China or India were financing the project.
name: India

title: China sent seismologists to India to help monitor aftershocks
description: China sent nine seismologists to India to help monitor the frequency of aftershocks. The team consists of nine experts in earthquake forecasting and monitoring.
name: Gujarat

title: China donates earthquake relief materials worth 5 million RMB to Gujarat, India
description: Following a devastating earthquake in India on January 26, 2001, the Government of China quickly sent relief materials worth 5 million RMB ($604,887 USD) to Gujarat. Specifically, China sent 10,700 dozens of zinc oxide adhesive plaster, 26,000 dozen bandages, 3,300 rolls of absorbent cotton wool, 20,000 pieces of acrylic blankets, and 2,000 tents. These goods were delivered on February 4, 2001. The United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) Financial Tracking Service lists the project as flow ID #2836 and reports it as completed.
name: Gujarat

title: China sent medical team to Gujarat, India for earthquake relief
description: On February 1, 2001, a Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs official announced that the Chinese government had decided to send a medical rescue team to Gujarat, India following the January 26, 2001 earthquake. The duration of the team's stay and the value of this project is unknown. The United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) Financial Tracking Service lists the project as flow ID #2806 and reports it as completed.
name: Gujarat

title: Red Cross Society of Hong Kong grants $96,429 USD to IFRC for disaster management control room in an orthopedic center in India
description: According to the United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) Financial Tracking Service (flow ID #20966), on 23 April 2004, the Red Cross Society of Hong Kong through the Red Cross Society of China donated $96,429 USD to the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies (IFRC) for a disaster management control room in the Indian Red Cross Society (IRCS) Orthopedic Center. All other project details are unknown.
name: Ahmadabad

title: CDB provides $100 million loan for 1320MW Coal-Fired Jhajjar Power Plant Project (Linked to Project ID #54343)
description:
On November 17, 2010, China Development Bank, China Eximbank, Hong Kong and Shanghai Banking Corporation, Standard Chartered Bank, and Bank of Tokyo-Mitsubishi UFJ provided a $288 million syndicated loan to CLP India Private Limited — a subsidiary of CLP Group — for the 1320MW Coal-Fired Power Plant Project in Jhajjar, Haryana. The loan carries a 13.5-year maturity. The loan’s final maturity date is May 17, 2024. The interest rate is unknown. 

China Eximbank reportedly contributed $88 million to the loan syndicate, while China Development Bank contributed $100 million. Sinosure provided insurance for the loan. The loan is refinancing a part of a Rs39 billion loan that CLP India Private Limited contracted in 2009 with Industrial Development Bank of India (IDBI). Project ID#54343 captures China Eximbank’s contribution and project ID#54344 captures China Development Bank’s contribution. 

SEPCO III/ Shandong Tiejun Engineering Company Limited is the EPC contractor responsible for project implementation. Construction began in January 2009. Stage one of the project involved installing 660 MW capacity and that was commissioned March 2012. Stage two of the project involved installing 660 MW capacity and it was commissioned on July 19, 2012.
name: Jhajjar

title: China Eximbank provides $88 million loan for 1320MW Coal-Fired Jhajjar Power Plant Project (Linked to Project ID #54344)
description:

title: China Development Bank, Bank of China, China Eximbank, and Standard Chartered Bank provide $1.114 billion loan for 3,960MW Coal-Fired Sasan Ultra Mega Power Project (UMPP) (Linked to Project ID #43106)
description:
On December 15, 2010, China Development Bank, Bank of China, China Eximbank, and Standard Chartered Bank signed a $1.114 billion syndicated loan agreement with Reliance Power Limited (R-Power) for the 3,960MW Coal-Fired Sasan Ultra Mega Power Project (UMPP). China Development Bank, Bank of China, China Eximbank reportedly contributed $1 billlion to the $1.114 billion syndicated loan. The loan carries a 13-year maturity and it is insured by Sinosure. Reliance Power announced that its 3960 MW Sasan Ultra Mega Power Project (SUMPP) has received the final commitment of term loans of Rs 5,000 crore ( USD 1,114 million ). 

The UMPP involves the construction and operation of a 3,960 MW coal-fired power plant and a captive coal mine in the village of Singrauli and the state of Madhya Pradesh. The proceeds from the syndicated loan were to be primarily used to purchase power equipment from Shanghai Electric (see Project ID #43107). 

The UMPP, which was officially commissioned on March 30, 2015, has 6 power towers of 660MW each and is a 'super-critical technology-based pit-head coal-fired power generating plant.' This project is linked to an earlier MOU captured in Project ID#43106. 

The 3,960MW Coal-Fired Sasan Ultra Mega Power Project (UMPP) is located in the village of Singrauli within the state of Madhya Pradesh. More detailed locational information can be found at https://www.google.com/maps/place/Sasan+Ultra+Mega+Power+Project/@23.983681,82.6183462,15z/data=!4m5!3m4!1s0x0:0x547cb50da5f63798!8m2!3d23.983681!4d82.6183462 and http://globalenergyobservatory.org/geoid/44406.

STAFF_NOTE: On August 7, 2007, R-Power formally acquired Sasan Power Limited, a special purpose vehicle that was formed to implement the UMPP. R-Power, formerly Reliance Energy Generation Limited (REGL) is a part of the Reliance Anil Dhirubhai Ambani Group. The company is the sole distributor of electricity to consumers in the suburbs of Mumbai. but in 2017 R-Power sold its Mumbai operation to Adani Power. R-Power also runs power generation, transmission and distribution businesses in other parts of Maharashtra, Goa and Andhra Pradesh. With its subsidiaries, it is developing 13 medium and large-sized power projects with a combined planned installed capacity of 33,480 MW. The Chinese name for this project is 印度莎圣项目.
name: Singrauli

title: Hong Kong donates $3.87 million HKD for drought relief in India
description: On 2 June 2016, The Standard reported that the Government of Hong Kong SAR's Disaster Relief Fund granted 3.87 million HKD (about $500,000 USD) to World Vision Hong Kong, a branch of an international NGO, for drought relief in Maharashtra, India. The United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) Financial Tracking Service captures this donation flow ID #150764 and marks it as paid.
name: Maharashtra

title: China Development Bank provides $166.67 million loan for Tiroda Thermal Power Project (Linked to Project ID#54345)
description:
On April 22, 2013, Adani Power Maharashtra Ltd (APML) — a special purpose vehicle and subsidiary of Adani Power — signed a $480 million syndicated loan agreement with China Development Bank, the Industrial and Commercial Bank of China (ICBC), and the Standard Chartered Bank for the 3300 MW Tiroda Thermal Power Project. Each bank reportedly contributed $166,670,000 to the loan syndicated. Project ID#53783 captures China Development Bank’s contribution and Project ID#54345 captures ICBC’s contribution. The syndicated loan carried a 10-year maturity. Its interest rate is unknown. 

The 3300 MW Tiroda Thermal Power Project involved the construction of five 660 MW units. APML was responsible for the financing, design, and implementation of the project. It has a long-term power purchase agreement (PPA) with Maharashtra state utility. Powergen Infrastructure was the turnkey contractor for the project. Sichuan Machinery & Equipment Import & Export Company (SCMEC) supplied equipment for the project. SCMEC, however, could not perform the contract works due to Visa policy issues with India. SCMEC, instead, guided the sub-contractors in the erection, commissioning, and operation of the equipment. This project was completed on October 11, 2014. 

This project is located in the village of Tiroda village with Gondia district and Maharashtra state. More detailed locational information can be found at http://globalenergyobservatory.org/geoid/43812#:~:text=Adani%20Tirora%20(Tiroda)%20Thermal%20Power%20Plant%20India%20is%20located%20at,%3D%2021.4129%2C%20Longitude%3D%2079.9671.

STAFF_NOTE: This Project is sometimes referred to as the 5x660 MW Gondia Coal-Fired Power Plant Project.”
name: Gondiya
